Perform limited repair of mechanical, electrical, electro-mechanical, plumbing and structural buildings systems throughout the campus. Experience performing limited repair and maintenance of plumbing/steam systems.Experience with common trade hand and power tools for repairs.Knowledge of the operation and maintenance of plumbing /steam systems, water treatment systems and other miscellaneous mechanical systems.Experience in diagnosing problems and making repairs to plumbing/steam systems.Knowledge of proper waste water disposal procedures.Computer skills to manage work assignments, cost estimating, schedules, preventative maintenance, and record keeping.Knowledge of standard maintenance, repair, and preventive maintenance programs and conventions.Knowledge of university and department policies, procedures and standard practices

column2: Sr. Job Captain - Food and Industrial Group
column5:
Location: 
Pleasanton, CA or Roseville, CA
Company:
ATI Architects and Engineers, Food and Industrial Group, has openings in our Pleasanton and Roseville offices to support our project teams in Southern California for Food Processing, Bottling, and Cold-Storage projects.  Projects are predominantly on the West Coast, but include locations throughout the US.  ATI is a nationally recognized design firm with three offices in California. Our Food and Industrial group is headquartered in Southern California.
Senior Job Captain – Food and Industrial Group
ATI has openings for Full Time Senior Job Captains for our Food and Industrial Group. Experience in Industrial, Commercial, Cold Storage and/or Food Processing design experience is ideal, but more important is a candidate who understands a variety of construction types, how to organize a set of construction documents, and how to detail and coordinate the necessary documents. Management skills and multi-office coordination skills will also be a plus.  In this position you will be working in our Pleasanton and Roseville offices directly with our Costa Mesa project teams, involved from the beginning of the project design through construction closeout. We offer a casual but high-energy office and a collaborative work space. We are committed to a progressive, diverse, exciting environment for our team members to grow and prosper in.
Typical tasks include:
 Coordinate with the project team including the architectural team and consulting engineers.  This will include coordination with ATI’s Southern California-based project team members.
 Supervise the technical work of production staff and review their drawings.
Work with Project Managers and/or Project Architects in establishing constructability and detailing.
 Assist the Project Managers and/or Project Architects in meeting project deliverables.
 Keep the production and consultant teams organized by planning and directing all project phases.
 Potential field work for verification of existing and as-built conditions where applicable.
 Perform design development and detailing, including assisting the Project Managers and Project Architects in developing creative solutions to design challenges.
 Working in CAD and Revit.
 Coordinate project submittals with Authorities Having Jurisdiction (AHJ).
 The successful candidate will have experience with and/or understanding of the following:
  8 to 10 years minimum in construction document production
 Commercial, and/or Industrial design: Food industry experience valuable
 Strong experience in AutoCAD, Revit skills preferred
 Ability to complete work on time, within budget, with a high degree of client satisfaction
 Strong team leadership and coordinating skills
 Ability to prioritize work with minimal supervision
 Mature judgment, tact, diplomacy, and firm grasp of the technical aspects of design projects
 Salary: Negotiable, DOE  
In addition, ATI offers a competitive compensation package that includes benefits, vacation, sick time, 401(K) match and bonus opportunities.
Please respond with your resume and one page cover letter at http://www.atiae.com/ati-profile/careers/. In your cover letter please explain why you believe you would benefit from this position and why you would be a good fit at ATI. 
Corporate Profile 
ATI Architects and Engineers is a part of the Planning Architecture Engineering Alliance, Inc. (PAEA). Headquartered in Los Angeles, CA, PAEA is comprised of four main firms, each independently operated.
 ATI Architects and Engineers – California-based (Pleasanton, Roseville, Costa Mesa) Architecture and Engineering leaders in Food Processing, Cold-storage, Industrial, K-12 Education, and Government sectors.
 AC Martin – Los Angeles-based Architecture, Planning, Interiors and Research firm with a vast design portfolio spanning over 100 years in Corporate, Commercial, Institutional, and Higher Education sectors.
 Togawa Smith Martin – Los Angeles-based design firm, recognized as leaders in Multi-Family Residential and Mixed-Use Retail/Residential architecture.
 PFVS – Atlanta-based, full service Architecture, Planning, and Interiors firm specializing in Hospitality Design across the US.

Grow with Us!
 Arborwell is a customer driven, professional Tree Care Management Company committed to providing arboricultural services that enhance the beauty, health, safety, and value of our trees. 
Our Mission is to cultivate mutually beneficial relationships with our clients and our employees, and we pride ourselves in our safe operating procedures, well-trained, uniformed employees, and top-of-the-line equipment.
We serve a wide variety of clients, including many of the largest commercial and property management companies, real estate developers and contractors, golf courses, parks and recreation areas, private residences and estates, and consulting arborists seeking partnerships for the most ambitious projects.
Arborwell is currently looking for an ISA Certified Arborist (Climber or Foreman level) for our Rancho Cordova office.  We would expect candidates to have at least 3 – 5 years in the Tree Care industry with solid climbing and pruning skills. We also place a high value on any other certifications you may have achieved, and will encourage you to continue with your Industry certifications through Arborwell.
Qualifications:
ISA Certified Arborist (Required)
Certified in CPR/First Aid
Driver's license with a clean DMV record
  Other Skills & Abilities:
Attention to detail is critical to maintain high quality of care.
Ability to work independently and within a team environment 
 Please contact our Human Resources department to apply, and/or for any additional information you may require.

Locations
Distribution Center - Dixon, CA 95620 US (Primary)
Job Title
Equipment Operator
Job Type
Full-time
Job Description
An equipment operator who is authorized and scheduled to drive either a forklift, order picker and/or yard dog, is responsible for moving, locating, relocating, consolidating, stacking, picking, and counting of merchandise. The Operator is accountable for the safe and efficient operation of the vehicle up to and including observing all maintenance procedures before and after driving. Based on work demand, this position does not exclude equipment operators from working in non-equipment areas.
The primary responsibilities/essential functions of this position include the following, but are subject to change based upon operating necessity:
Strong customer service orientation, work ethic, and attention to detail.
Excellent organizational, time management, and follow up skills.
Strong sense of urgency to effectively complete multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
Verbal and written communication skills which clearly and succinctly communicate across various audience levels.
Ability to work independently or as a team to achieve organizational goals.
Strong active listening skills.
Lift boxes up to 60lbs and move them from one location to another.
Operate a hand pallet jack to move filled pallets of merchandise, up to 1,000 lbs. within the DC.
Pushing merchandise on rolling carts, up to 100 lbs.
Operate forklift using all safety guidelines to retrieve merchandise from upper racks and to move merchandise as needed.
Pick up and appropriately discard all boxes, cartons, and strapping tape to ensure a clean and safe work environment.
Job Requirements
Basic PC skills. Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and Internet Explorer.
Accurately use basic math skills: addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
Understand and follow all safety procedures and guidelines within the D.C.
Work experience in a warehouse environment.
Utilize the STS/RDM system to enter merchandise location into the system.
Able to read and interpret a packing slip, invoice, RF device, etc.
Work Hours and Environment:
Typical work hours for day shift are Monday through Friday, 6:00am - 2:30pm
Typical work hours for swing shift are Monday through Friday, 2:45pm - 11:15pm
Typical work hours for third shift are Sunday through Thursday, 9:00am - 5:30am
Overtime and weekend work may be required based on business needs.
Work in a warehouse setting and possess the ability to work on your feet throughout the shift
Why You’ll Love Working With Us:
The Product—so good, you’ll be using your employee discount more than you probably should
The People—ask anyone that works here…we have incredible people on our team
The Experience—you’ll enjoy a rewarding career at a respected global children’s brand
The Benefits—health insurance, 401k match, and onsite wellness services for your convenience
Let’s Talk Perks!
Generous Health Savings Account (HSA) employer contributions for individuals and families
Flexible Spending Accounts
Paid holidays and flexible time off
30% off merchandise employee discount (Gymboree & Outlet, Janie and Jack, Crazy 8 & Outlet)
Gymboree Play & Music class discounts
Educational Assistance Development Program
Life insurance (self, spouse/domestic partner, children)
Additional corporate discounts at participating companies
Communication done throughout the interviewing process will be via email, so be sure to include a valid email address when applying.
The Gymboree Distribution Center uses SparkHire, an online video interviewing platform, for candidates to complete their initial assessments at their convenience. Candidates may also choose to complete a phone interview in lieu of video interviews.
We conduct thorough criminal background checks and drug screens.**

Do your team members see you as a role model and leader? Do you want to work for a company where your work matters? Do you enjoy traveling and being able to work on different job sites? If so, we want you on our team!
 Foremen at SmartWatt not only help ensure projects are completed on‐time, in the safest possible manner, and are delivered with the highest quality, but also are a leader and role model to a team of Lighting Technicians. As a Foreman, you provide direction and training to Technicians which directly influences the end result of a project. You not only help make business facilities more efficient and less costly, but also improve the safety, health and comfort for those using them.
 How do you make an impact?
Promote and role model safe practices following all SmartWatt and OSHA guidelines and actively participate in and complete regular safety training.
Assist with proper training of Lighting Technicians on all SmartWatt policies, procedures and practices, along with National Electrical Code (NEC) guidelines.
Provide clear and proper direction to team members and ensure appropriate project prioritization.
Accurately assemble and install lamps, ballasts and other lighting components within various fixture types and follow all National Electrical Code guidelines.
Ensure that the jobsite is maintained to the highest standards to include: cleaned, prepared and all possible hazards eliminated.
Provide a top notch customer experience that leaves a lasting impression; always interact in a professional and respectful manner and go above and beyond expectations.
Collaborate with team members to complete projects on‐time.
Foremen at SmartWatt have access to our in‐house Learning, Education, Achievement and Development (L.E.A.D) Training Program. This program encourages development and provides tools for career progression. Come develop your career with us!
 The core components for success in this role include (i.e. must haves):
 A High School Diploma
Valid California Journeyman's License 
At least 2 years of experience in a Foreman level role or construction management
At least 5 years of experience in commercial electrical, lighting retrofit, and/or related experience or training
Previous experience with Safety planning and administration
An ability to work varying shifts as needed to include nights, holidays, weekends and overtime
Active Driver’s License
 The following are a definite plus, so if you’ve got any of these be sure to tell us!
 Electrical Trade school or technical training (highly preferred)
OSHA 10
Experience with energy conservation lighting projects
Mechanical experience and/or aptitude
 Our most successful Foremen come to us with the following knowledge, skills and abilities:

Safety knowledge; understands safety practices and has a history of complying with all safety policies and procedures.
Safety promotion; history of advocating safety best practices and contributing to a safety first culture.
Technical knowledge;
Field applicable knowledge and understanding of the National Electrical Code, electrical principles, electrical diagrams, construction drawings and blueprints.
Proper use of hand and power tools; familiarity with and ability to properly use multi‐ meters, aerial work platforms and ladders/scaffolds
Familiarity with Lighting and Lighting Controls, Emergency Lighting Systems, and GFCI Protection
Basic knowledge of wiring; low voltage wiring and termination of wiring systems
Basic knowledge and proven ability in electrician’s math.
Leadership; history of successfully leading electrical teams; being seen as a leader and role model.
Communication; ability to communication across all levels of an organization.
Asset management; a knowledge, understanding and ability to manage assets to include resource control, cost awareness and fleet management.
Planning; proven success in project scheduling; effectively setting priorities and meeting timelines
Work quality; history of producing high quality work
Quality control; history of ensuring that work performed adheres to quality standards and taking corrective action when required.
Quantity of work; ability to meet the demands of the project timeline
Customer focus; passionate about ensuring happy customers
 SmartWatt is a purpose‐led company and it is important that all SmartWatt‐ers share the following values:
Commit to Win – for SmartWatt, there’s value in winning. Winning is fun. It creates energy, fuels momentum, stimulates growth and defines success.
Deliver on Commitments – Integrity is not a tired cliché with SmartWatt. Keeping our word and keeping it real are at the heart of our corporate DNA.
Outperform Yourself – We love what we do and we seize every opportunity to outperform our competitors, but more importantly – to always outperform ourselves, knowing there is always a next level.
Embrace the Unconventional – The status quo, the way it’s always been done, predetermined solutions and convention wisdom are the basics, not the end game here.
Connect & Collaborate – In our client relationship, partner alliances and in the SmartWatt culture there is no winning without shared values and ongoing collaboration.

 To be successful at SmartWatt these values MUST resonate with you.
 The work environment:
 As a Foreman, you will spend the majority of your time working on various job sites which will require frequent driving or as a passenger in a vehicle. While on jobsites, the majority of your day is spent standing and walking. You will frequently be required to work safely from ladders and various lifts, as well as safely lift and/or move up to 50 lbs. You will frequently need to be able to see (with or without correction) and correctly identify common colors. While on customer sites the environment can vary and there is potential to be exposed to hazardous conditions, extreme temperatures and/or dusty or noisy conditions. The position also regularly communicates with co‐workers and occasionally communicates with customers which requires the ability to exchange accurate information in an understandable way.
 The travel required for this position is 75‐100% of the time. It is mostly regional; however, national travel is a possibility.
 Come join a company that is committed to going further to understand what is needed and engineer what is possible.
  What we do?
 SmartWatt is a nationwide, fast‐growing company that maximizes the value of infrastructures by optimizing energy and building systems. We design and build energy efficiency upgrade projects that help our customers achieve financial savings, energy reductions and an enhanced environment that fosters productivity, comfort and safety.
 Why we do it?
 We are driven and passionate about partnering with our customers and providing expertise to create more efficient and optimized environments for their employees, students, teachers and communities to thrive in. We strive to be better, do better and achieve better results for our customers. Our teams of experts don’t follow trends. We set them. We embrace change. We challenge the norm. We make promises ‐ and we keep them. We earn our customers' business by creating value for them, showing genuine concern and understanding of their needs, building deep relationships, and ensuring they are happy. Our customers see and feel our constant care for every project.
 Our Benefits and Perks…
 At SmartWatt, we ensure you are supported and valued. To help do this, we offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. Check out our benefits page for a list of ways that SmartWatt supports your health, your future and how we have some fun while doing it!
 In true SmartWatt fashion, we are continually reviewing and re‐imagining what we can offer to meet our employee’s needs. We reward our team’s hard work and talent in a way that is valuable to them.

column2: Construction Industry Research & Development Tax Senior - (Job Number: 17422)
column5:
Employee Status:
Regular
Schedule: Full TimeSacramento, CA
Why Moss Adams? Moss Adams brings more West to business. We’re excited by the greatness of possibility and the extraordinary potential for companies and individuals to prosper. With more than 2,600 professionals across 20-plus locations in the West and beyond, Moss Adams provides the world’s most innovative companies with specialized accounting, consulting, and wealth management services to help them embrace emerging opportunity.



The Tax Specialty Group at Moss Adams specializes in international, federal, and state and local tax services designed to help our clients reduce their tax liability, increase cash flow, and manage risk. The R&D Tax Credit team at Moss Adams assists a wide variety of companies to identify and quantify federal and state research tax credits. They perform R&D tax credit studies, interview clients and document eligible tax credit criteria, research and draft technical memoranda regarding R&D and tax issues, as well as assist with other projects as assigned.



Individuals who thrive at Moss Adams exhibit the following success skills – Collaboration, Critical Thinking, Emotional Intelligence, Executive Presence, Growth Mindset, Intellectual Curiosity, and Results Focus.



Responsibilities:

Assists in planning and running of R&D engagements primarily in the construction industry
Schedules and conducts informational gathering interviews with clients
Obtains and organizes documentation obtained from the client
Performs tax research
Drafts technical reports and correspondence
Assists with taxing authority audit defense
Mentor staff


Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree required; emphasis in Accounting, Business, Construction Management or Engineering preferred
Advanced degree preferred (e.g. MST, JD, or LL.M)
CPA, bar membership or equivalent credential preferred
Minimum of 2 years of related experience in R&D tax credits or tax compliance
Strong data analytical and Excel stills
Excellent client service skills internal and external
Critical thinking and problem solving skills
Strong research ability
Strong written and verbal communication
Ability to work effectively both as part of a team and independently
Ability to handle multiple priorities, tasks and simultaneous projects

What you’ll be doing...
We are constantly innovating to bring the latest technologies to our customers and you can be part of this team. You will be responsible for building and maintaining America’s largest and most reliable cellular network. As a Project Manager in Wireless Construction, you will manage a variety of internal and external partners and vendors to oversee construction and maintenance for a regional network of cell site projects. Your vital role will ensure that these multi-stakeholder, complex projects are delivered on time, to specifications, and within budget.
Collaborating with stakeholders to establish project designs, scope, deliverables and timelines.
Developing and maintaining detailed schedules for each project and actively managing the scheduled tasks with outside vendors including major milestones, action items, long lead purchases, and any other commitments that would impact the project schedule.
Analyzing implications of changes from the original schedule and taking required corrective actions to ensure the project stays on track.
Providing regular project status reports to management and the project team.
Coordinating and overseeing the issuance of RFQs and the evaluation of responses, based on purchasing requirements, and providing detailed analysis and recommendations for the best candidates.
Working closely with Real Estate, Equipment Engineers and Facilities Engineers to ensure cell site construction issues are proactively identified and resolved and requirements are met.
Developing and maintaining a detailed schedule for each project and actively manage the scheduled tasks with outside vendors including major milestones, action items, long lead purchases and any other commitments that would impact the project schedule.
Completing receipts of service purchase orders and ensuring that invoices are paid in a timely manner according to federal and state regulations.
Managing the regional monthly cell capital plan ensuring spending accuracy in monthly forecasting and performing monthly reconciliation of YTD monthly spending by budget item.
What we’re looking for...
You enjoy managing complex, large-scale projects impacting a large variety of stakeholders, both internal and external. You have a keen eye for detail, but never lose sight of the big picture. Being results-driven and well-organized, you are adept at identifying potential project roadblocks and developing mitigation strategies. Excellent communication and team building skills enable you to negotiate with internal and external partners to ensure nothing gets in the way of success. You thrive in a fast-paced, high demand environment, making effective decisions quickly, and juggling competing priorities with ease.
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
Three or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience managing projects and process/program management experience.
Experience with budget tracking, cost estimation, and cost accounting of capital plans.
Even better if you have:
A degree.
Ericsson/Nokia, DC plant design, and general construction knowledge.
Knowledge of fiber installation and standards.
Experience in telecommunications / data networking or wireless industry.
When you join Verizon...
You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon.
Equal Employment Opportunity
We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences,including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

Since 1919, Kennedy/Jenks Consultants has provided engineering, scientific, and construction solutions to municipal agencies, businesses, and industrial facilities.  With offices serving clients throughout the United States, we provide consulting services nationwide. 
  We are currently seeking an experienced Senior Construction Manager with strong leadership skills and outstanding work ethic to work on major water/wastewater related infrastructure projects.  Responsibilities will include business development and client management working in close conjunction with other Kennedy/Jenks Program Management / Construction Management Group senior staff. We have opportunities available in several of our West Coast offices.
  SUMMARY:
  Assigned to the Construction Management Group, the primary responsibilities of this position include oversight of water/wastewater pipeline, pump station, reservoir and treatment plant construction projects. Work includes day-today construction management/contract administration, field observations, field problem resolution, coordination/conducting meetings with contractors, clients, and staff; scheduling; Quality Assurance, Change Management, and providing expert advice to our clients. Travel may be required.
  QUALIFICATIONS:
  At least 12 years of experience working in the water-wastewater construction and/or construction management industry. 
Background must include experience in general contracting and/or engineering and construction management. Specifically, the applicant must possess knowledge and experience in managing complex construction projects including the construction of water/wastewater facilities from Notice to Proceed through start-up/commissioning/closeout.
A strong knowledge and experience of safe work practices is required.  
Successful candidates will have strong teamwork, organization, problem solving, and communication skills.  Candidates with multi-discipline construction management experience are highly desired. 
Construction Management Association of America CCM or Engineering PE certification or ability to obtain same within 12 months a plus.
Applicants must be proficient with Microsoft Office, Word and Excel, with scheduling experience in either Microsoft Project and/or P-6 a plus.
  As an employee-owned firm, Kennedy/Jenks offers a unique company culture with a corporate commitment to a maintaining a positive work/life experience.  Kennedy/Jenks Consultants provides excellent compensation and comprehensive benefits packages, including career advancement opportunities, outstanding training opportunities, stock ownership, profit sharing and excellent health, dental, and life insurance.
  Kennedy/Jenks Consultants is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Description
Tradesmen International is seeking highly motivated concrete finishers to join our team.  If you are a concrete finisher this is your chance to launch your career.  As a Concrete Finisher also known as a concrete mason you will be responsible for smoothing, leveling and finishing freshly poured concrete. 
Specific responsibilities:
Smooth out concrete in segments to ensure the concrete poured is level
Arrange the concrete forms
Prepare surface with hammer and chose
Rub cement in with sponge-rubber float or burlap
Level concrete using special blades, making sure all lumps and bubbles are smoothed over
Use wood or plastic forms to shape the concrete and hold it until it is set
Wash away excess concrete.
Finish corners by hand
Apply latex and epoxy to floors
Use machines that vibrate concrete to fill air pockets
Use groovers and hand trowels to spread concrete
Requirements
Simply put, we're not a temp agency and don't just hire anyone. In fact, we're highly selective, committed to hiring only those concrete finishers that are highly skilled in their trade with unwavering reliability, strong work ethic, and a desire to be the best.
 Specific requirements:
  4 years of experience in commercial/industrial concrete finishing
Must be reliable and self-motivated
Have the ability and knowledge to read prints
Experience working with hand tools and power tools
Strong working knowledge of job site safety
High standard of integrity and professionalism
Drug free at all times
 Company Details
In addition to consistent work, top pay, and employment opportunities, we provide a benefits package that includes:
Vacation Pay
Health insurance
Dental and vision plan
Prescription drug plan
Life insurance
Short-term disability
401(k) profit-sharing savings plan
Incentive programs
Tool purchase programs

Overview
Allied Universal Services is currently searching for a Professional Security Site Supervisor in Downtown Sacramento, CA.
The Professional Security Officer is the heart of Allied Universal Services. Our officers allow us to accomplish our companys core purpose which is to serve, secure and care for the people and businesses in our communities.
Apply online and follow up with our local office:
8950 Cal Center Drive, Suite 115
Sacramento, CA 95826
Phone: 916.448.0400
Allied Universal provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americas leading security services provider. Allied Universal, North Americas leading security services provider, is experiencing tremendous growth. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, vision, flex spending, 401K, an anniversary bonus, and an on-the-spot recognition program.? We promote from within our company!?You can start with little, to no, security experience and become one of Allied Universals many success stories.
Apply to join the LARGEST SECURITY COMPANY in the United States!
Job Description
The Security Site Supervisor will supervise and coordinate the delivery of quality services to an assigned customer. Act as a liaison between customer, Operation Manager and security officers. Supervise site staff, providing coaching, recognition and discipline within approved empowerment range.
Supervisory Responsibilities
Communicates staffing needs to Operation Manager which may include using the Requisition process, assisting in identifying and interviewing quality candidates
Assures that officers receive appropriate training, developing them in both technical and professional skills; also includes performance management (coaching, counseling, disciplining, performance evaluations, recognition, etc.)
Assures that employee grievances are heard with help from appropriate branch or region HR support employees
Assists with the communication of policies, company announcements and job openings
Provides the basis of a great place to work by treating staff with respect
Enforcement of Contract Standards
Helps Operations Manager identify, meet and exceed the needs of the customer
Meets all contractual scheduled hours with a minimum of unbilled overtime
Coordinates and/or conduct site-specific OJT, client specific training and annual refresher training for security personnel
Reconciles security logs against shift responsibilities and patrols; review incident reports prior to submitting to manager and coordinate preliminary investigations
Performs account audits and off-hour visits, completing required documentation
Manages uniforms, equipment, supplies and vehicles utilized at the account, maintaining appropriate inventories and maintenance checklists
Administrative Management
Administers site safety programs outlining site-specific hazards for security officers including vehicle / driving safety as appropriate to corporate procedures
Prepared to participate in unemployment hearings
Capably utilizes scheduling and billing software, and to produce reports (such as Scheduling Activity, Training Detail reports, etc.) that require interpretation and action for effective business management
Enforces Allied Universals policies as outlined in the handbooks and executive memos
Physical and Mental Functions:
Stand or walk constantly (for up to an entire shift) on various surfaces (tile, concrete, carpet)
Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
Occasionally bend/twist at waist/knees/neck to perform various duties
Occasionally lift or carry up to 40 pounds
Run as needed
Constant use of both hands and arms in reaching/handling/grasping/fingering while using phone, notepad, writing reports, and other administrative tasks
Constant use of eyes (correctable vision to normal level required) to observe, read, interact with public and co-workers, view security monitors; includes hand/eye coordination
Work in various environments including adverse outdoor conditions such as cold, rain or heat;
Constant mental alertness and attention to detail required while setting priorities and following up on assignments
Qualifications/Requirements:
Qualified applicants for the Security Site Supervisor position will meet the minimum requirements, as described below:
High school diploma or equivalent required
At least 21 years of age
Must possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner; must be able to use initiative and independent judgment within established guidelines
Must be able to frequently prepare written reports and logs in neat, legible handwriting; may require computer skills
Must be able to read and understand all operating procedures and instructions
Must be able to obtain a valid Guard License as required in the state for which you are applying
As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background investigation and a post-offer/pre-employment drug/alcohol test and may be required to pass Drivers Record check
As a condition of continued employment, employee must maintain current active status of all required License at all times, and must carry the license at all times while on duty
Must display exceptional customer service and communication skills
Remain flexible to ever changing environments; adapt well to different situations
Intermediate computer skills to utilize innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
Ability to maintain satisfactory attendance and punctuality standard;
Neat and professional appearance
Ability to provide quality customer service
Ability to handle both common and crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently
Read, understand and clearly speak English; constantly use speech and hearing (correctable to normal level required) in communicating with public/co-workers, giving and receiving instructions, using phones
Must be able to handle pressure of working with high volume general public (constantly to occasionally depending on assignment)
Closing
Allied Universal provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North Americas leading security services provider. With over 140,000 employees, Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information: 866.825.5433 or www.AUS.com.
We proudly support the Veteran Jobs Mission, a group of over 200 companies that have committed to collectively hiring a total of one million military veterans.

Since 2002, LEAF Engineers has been a frontrunner for success in providing comprehensive mechanical, electrical and plumbing/fire protection engineering design services. Our engineers are focused on system performance, reliability, flexibility and ease of maintenance. With an emphasis on teamwork, we reach beyond the traditional MEP approach to solve problems and integrate a more holistic approach to our processes. We strive to bring only the best to our team, is that you?
LEAF Engineers is seeking an experienced HVAC/Plumbing Engineer/Designer for our rapidly growing practice in Sacramento, CA. As an integral member of the Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) team, the Senior HVAC/Plumbing Engineer/Designer produces construction documents to fulfill clients’ goals. This position is also responsible to QA/QC construction documents, provide design ideas and solutions, and train or mentor other Designers, Operators or Engineers.
Responsibilities
Develops, modifies and reviews Revit models of HVAC and plumbing systems and components according to established standards and Revit modeling techniques, based on input from the engineering team.
Creates project drawings from the Revit model.
Organizes and maintains Revit models and AutoCAD documents for multiple projects.
Designs projects in a team environment and mentors and directs the work of less experienced staff.
Works closely with project team and assists to complete projects on aggressive schedules.
Performs all work in a clear, complete, and accurate manner.
Uses Revit to check the design for interferences with other building elements, resolves conflicts with other team members.
Utilizes knowledge and experience in applying modeling principles for drawings.
Produces equipment schedules, making changes and adjustments as necessary with input from the engineering team as required.
Utilizes knowledge and experience in applying drafting principles for drawings.
Implements and utilizes LEAF Engineers Standards for projects and processes.
Actively seeks new knowledge related to engineering practices, principles and regulations changes.
Fosters a commitment to external and internal client service.
Skills
Advanced knowledge of engineering principles and practices.
Advanced knowledge of building codes.
Advanced knowledge of electrical [mechanical] systems and equipment.
Ability to design and model simple and complex plumbing systems or large plumbing systems.
Ability to produce coordinated floor plans, riser diagrams, and isometrics with limited guidance of more senior staff.
Ability to interpret consultant design documents (for instance kitchen consultant's equipment layouts, equipment schedule and catalog cuts) and design the necessary plumbing system.
Select plumbing equipment and layout the required equipment space.
Coordinate with technology and electrical designers to coordinate the requirements.
Advanced knowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles involved in production of plans, sections diagrams and equipment schedules, and drawings.
Proficiency in Revit, including BIM and AutoCAD required.
Proficiency in MS Office, including Word, Excel and Outlook.
Knowledge about sustainability, integrated design and LEED guidelines.
Ability to perform standard computer drafting functions using Revit and AutoCAD and be able to resolve design conflicts
Ability to effectively meet deadlines.
Ability to communicate both verbally and in writing.
Ability to work in team environment.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in engineering required.
PE license in California preferred
Five years of drafting experience working on one or more of the following building types: K-12, higher education, commercial, corporate, institutional and civic, justice, science and technology, aviation or healthcare facilities.
Experience working and coordinating with integrated teams
LEED credential required within 6 months of employment.
Firm Background
Join a culture where you can have a direct and immediate impact on company growth and customer satisfaction. Leaf Engineers is a financially stable company with a history of continuous growth, providing a pool of resources to draw on for support, with a focus on customer satisfaction and sustainable design. Advancement opportunities exist with this position.

Master Halco, one of the nation's largest wholesale distributors of fencing products has an immediate opportunity available for an experienced Welder.  Cuts, prepares and lays-up pipe sections on table or jig and welds using MIG/ARC welding equipment and techniques.  Works from sales order and/or verbal instructions in locating material and processing.  May perform miscellaneous welding on occasion and fabricate/fill welded gate frames.

1. Using verbal or written instruction from sales orders, locates material from stock in warehouse or yard and transports it ot a pipe preparation/welding area.
2. Notches, bends and swedges pipe sections, as needed using power equipment and cuts pipe to indicated lengths using a tape measure and pipe cutting equipment.
3. Lays out pipe sections on a jig or table and welds with MIG/ARC welding equipment and techniques, applies cold galvanizing solution to protect welds.
4. Maintains welding equipment by changing gas bottles and welding wire, as well as some maintenance to welding equipment and other miscellaneous machinery.
5. Inspects completed gate frame for proper specifications using tape measure and square.
6. May assist in gate fabrication including gate filling and addition of fittings and scrolling using hand tools.
7. May perform miscellaneous duties depending upon size of the branch including loading/unloading trucks, filling customer orders, etc.
8. May operate other machinery such as forklifts.
9. May be required to go to job sites and make adjustments on gates for customers who are having problems with installation due to damage during shpping on fabrication.

1. 3-5 yrs. welding experience with MIG,ARC welding and torch cutting and previous fence experience.
2. Able to perform own layouts and use jigs.
3. Physically able to lift 75 lbs repeatedly.
4. Must be able to work around heat and chemicals.
 Why Join Master Halco?
A culture that values opportunity for growth, development and internal promotion
Competitive compensation package
Comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefits programs
401 K retirement savings program with company match
Tuition reimbursement
Generous paid time off and paid holidays
Donation match program

 • Understands Sutter Difference principals/pillars, communicates these principals to staff and clinicians, and implements process improvement initiatives.

 • Consistently and effectively implements and monitors policies, workflows, and training.
 • Demonstrates appropriate judgment regarding daily operating issues of a specific care center
 • Supports, participates and manages the implementation of new system initiatives.
 • Responsible for maintaining IMQ Accreditation Standards. Conducts and documents the monthly IMQ Accreditation Site Survey as well as the monthly Hazard Survey and ensures all logs are up to date.
 • Monitors, communicates and implements action plans as needed based on results of employee, clinician and patient satisfaction surveys.
 • Oversees the operational day to day activities at care centers, accounting units and/or sites to maximize productivity and cost effectiveness within a high quality medical delivery system.
 • Responds to patient, clinician and family requests; investigates/documents complaints.
 • Coordinates resolution of staff issues including major discipline with the Regional Administrative Director and the Human Resources Department.

Financial Performance
 • Monitors the financial performance of the care center.  Responsible for care center expenses/revenue, particularly staffing levels, supply use, patient access, cash collections, and billing.
 • Monitors time sheets and overtime management. Reviews for accuracy and approves.

Staff Development
 • Develops staff skills and knowledge using development tools, mentoring, education, special projects and other methods of professional development.
 • Conducts annual performance reviews for all non-exempt employees including 30/60/90 reviews for new hires on time.

Communication
 • Attends monthly supervisor meetings, bringing information back to staff
 • Communicates through regularly scheduled and frequent staff and clinician meetings.

Qualifications
MINIMUM POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
 Education:
High School Diploma is required, Associates Degree or higher in a health or business-related field is Preferred. 
  Experience: 
Prior managerial or supervisory experience is required.  

Knowledge: 
Preferred knowledge of computerized practice management systems and electronic health records.Ability to organize and set priorities to ensure that objectives are met in a timely manner. Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with physicians and care center staff. Ability to oversee day to day care center, accounting unit and/or site operations. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrated computer experience - Windows, Microsoft Office

Martin is the employer of choice for those looking for progressive growth with a stable future. Our company culture is "family-run business" within a multinational corporation. Come join our team and see why others are choosing Martin to take their careers to the next level!

In this role you will be involved in the welding of metal parts and operating industrial machine tools to complete customer orders in a conveyor shop.

column2: Sr. Job Captain - Food and Industrial Group
column5:
Location: 
Pleasanton, CA or Roseville, CA
Company:
ATI Architects and Engineers, Food and Industrial Group, has openings in our Pleasanton and Roseville offices to support our project teams in Southern California for Food Processing, Bottling, and Cold-Storage projects.  Projects are predominantly on the West Coast, but include locations throughout the US.  ATI is a nationally recognized design firm with three offices in California. Our Food and Industrial group is headquartered in Southern California.
Senior Job Captain – Food and Industrial Group
ATI has openings for Full Time Senior Job Captains for our Food and Industrial Group. Experience in Industrial, Commercial, Cold Storage and/or Food Processing design experience is ideal, but more important is a candidate who understands a variety of construction types, how to organize a set of construction documents, and how to detail and coordinate the necessary documents. Management skills and multi-office coordination skills will also be a plus.  In this position you will be working in our Pleasanton and Roseville offices directly with our Costa Mesa project teams, involved from the beginning of the project design through construction closeout. We offer a casual but high-energy office and a collaborative work space. We are committed to a progressive, diverse, exciting environment for our team members to grow and prosper in.
Typical tasks include:
 Coordinate with the project team including the architectural team and consulting engineers.  This will include coordination with ATI’s Southern California-based project team members.
 Supervise the technical work of production staff and review their drawings.
Work with Project Managers and/or Project Architects in establishing constructability and detailing.
 Assist the Project Managers and/or Project Architects in meeting project deliverables.
 Keep the production and consultant teams organized by planning and directing all project phases.
 Potential field work for verification of existing and as-built conditions where applicable.
 Perform design development and detailing, including assisting the Project Managers and Project Architects in developing creative solutions to design challenges.
 Working in CAD and Revit.
 Coordinate project submittals with Authorities Having Jurisdiction (AHJ).
 The successful candidate will have experience with and/or understanding of the following:
  8 to 10 years minimum in construction document production
 Commercial, and/or Industrial design: Food industry experience valuable
 Strong experience in AutoCAD, Revit skills preferred
 Ability to complete work on time, within budget, with a high degree of client satisfaction
 Strong team leadership and coordinating skills
 Ability to prioritize work with minimal supervision
 Mature judgment, tact, diplomacy, and firm grasp of the technical aspects of design projects
 Salary: Negotiable, DOE  
In addition, ATI offers a competitive compensation package that includes benefits, vacation, sick time, 401(K) match and bonus opportunities.
Please respond with your resume and one page cover letter at http://www.atiae.com/ati-profile/careers/. In your cover letter please explain why you believe you would benefit from this position and why you would be a good fit at ATI. 
Corporate Profile 
ATI Architects and Engineers is a part of the Planning Architecture Engineering Alliance, Inc. (PAEA). Headquartered in Los Angeles, CA, PAEA is comprised of four main firms, each independently operated.
 ATI Architects and Engineers – California-based (Pleasanton, Roseville, Costa Mesa) Architecture and Engineering leaders in Food Processing, Cold-storage, Industrial, K-12 Education, and Government sectors.
 AC Martin – Los Angeles-based Architecture, Planning, Interiors and Research firm with a vast design portfolio spanning over 100 years in Corporate, Commercial, Institutional, and Higher Education sectors.
 Togawa Smith Martin – Los Angeles-based design firm, recognized as leaders in Multi-Family Residential and Mixed-Use Retail/Residential architecture.
 PFVS – Atlanta-based, full service Architecture, Planning, and Interiors firm specializing in Hospitality Design across the US.

Job Description
An equipment operator who is authorized and scheduled to drive either a forklift, order picker and/or yard dog, is responsible for moving, locating, relocating, consolidating, stacking, picking, and counting of merchandise. The Operator is accountable for the safe and efficient operation of the vehicle up to and including observing all maintenance procedures before and after driving. Based on work demand, this position does not exclude equipment operators from working in non-equipment areas.
The primary responsibilities/essential functions of this position include the following, but are subject to change based upon operating necessity:
Strong customer service orientation, work ethic, and attention to detail.
Excellent organizational, time management, and follow up skills.
Strong sense of urgency to effectively complete multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
Verbal and written communication skills which clearly and succinctly communicate across various audience levels.
Ability to work independently or as a team to achieve organizational goals.
Strong active listening skills.
Lift boxes up to 60lbs and move them from one location to another.
Operate a hand pallet jack to move filled pallets of merchandise, up to 1,000 lbs. within the DC.
Pushing merchandise on rolling carts, up to 100 lbs.
Operate forklift using all safety guidelines to retrieve merchandise from upper racks and to move merchandise as needed.
Pick up and appropriately discard all boxes, cartons, and strapping tape to ensure a clean and safe work environment.

Accurately use basic math skills: addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
Understand and follow all safety procedures and guidelines within the D.C.
Work experience in a warehouse environment.
Utilize the STS/RDM system to enter merchandise location into the system.
Able to read and interpret a packing slip, invoice, RF device, etc.

Overtime and weekend work may be required based on business needs.
Work in a warehouse setting and possess the ability to work on your feet throughout the shift

column2: Security Site Supervisor - Highrise Building Downtown Sacramento
column5:
Overview
Allied Universal Services is currently searching for a Professional Security Site Supervisor in Downtown Sacramento, CA.
 The Professional Security Officer is the heart of Allied Universal Services. Our officers allow us to accomplish our company’s core purpose which is “to serve, secure and care for the people and businesses in our communities”.
 Apply online and follow up with our local office:
8950 Cal Center Drive, Suite 115Sacramento, CA 95826Phone: 916.448.0400 
Allied Universal provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North America’s leading security services provider. Allied Universal, North America’s leading security services provider, is experiencing tremendous growth. For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, vision, flex spending, 401K, an anniversary bonus, and an on-the-spot recognition program.  We promote from within our company! You can start with little, to no, security experience and become one of Allied Universal’s many success stories.
 Apply to join the LARGEST SECURITY COMPANY in the United States!
Job Description
The Security Site Supervisor will supervise and coordinate the delivery of quality services to an assigned customer. Act as a liaison between customer, Operation Manager and security officers. Supervise site staff, providing coaching, recognition and discipline within approved empowerment range.
Supervisory Responsibilities
Communicates staffing needs to Operation Manager which may include using the Requisition process, assisting in identifying and interviewing quality candidates
Assures that officers receive appropriate training, developing them in both technical and professional skills; also includes performance management (coaching, counseling, disciplining, performance evaluations, recognition, etc.)
Assures that employee grievances are heard with help from appropriate branch or region HR support employees
Assists with the communication of policies, company announcements and job openings
Provides the basis of a great place to work by treating staff with respect
Enforcement of Contract Standards
Helps Operations Manager identify, meet and exceed the needs of the customer
Meets all contractual scheduled hours with a minimum of unbilled overtime
Coordinates and/or conduct site-specific OJT, client specific training and annual refresher training for security personnel
Reconciles security logs against shift responsibilities and patrols; review incident reports prior to submitting to manager and coordinate preliminary investigations
Performs account audits and off-hour visits, completing required documentation
Manages uniforms, equipment, supplies and vehicles utilized at the account, maintaining appropriate inventories and maintenance checklists
Administrative Management
Administers site safety programs outlining site-specific hazards for security officers including vehicle / driving safety as appropriate to corporate procedures
Prepared to participate in unemployment hearings
Capably utilizes scheduling and billing software, and to produce reports (such as Scheduling Activity, Training Detail reports, etc.) that require interpretation and action for effective business management
Enforces Allied Universal’s policies as outlined in the handbooks and executive memos
Physical and Mental Functions:
Stand or walk constantly (for up to an entire shift) on various surfaces (tile, concrete, carpet)
Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
Occasionally bend/twist at waist/knees/neck to perform various duties
Occasionally lift or carry up to 40 pounds
Run as needed
Constant use of both hands and arms in reaching/handling/grasping/fingering while using phone, notepad, writing reports, and other administrative tasks
Constant use of eyes (correctable vision to normal level required) to observe, read, interact with public and co-workers, view security monitors; includes hand/eye coordination
Work in various environments including adverse outdoor conditions such as cold, rain or heat;
Constant mental alertness and attention to detail required while setting priorities and following up on assignments
Qualifications/Requirements:
Qualified applicants for the Security Site Supervisor position will meet the minimum requirements, as described below:

Job Title
Equipment Operator 1 (Swing Shift)
Job Type
Full-time
Job Description
An equipment operator who is authorized and scheduled to drive either a forklift, order picker and/or yard dog, is responsible for moving, locating, relocating, consolidating, stacking, picking, and counting of merchandise. The Operator is accountable for the safe and efficient operation of the vehicle up to and including observing all maintenance procedures before and after driving. Based on work demand, this position does not exclude equipment operators from working in non-equipment areas.
The primary responsibilities/essential functions of this position include the following, but are subject to change based upon operating necessity:
Strong customer service orientation, work ethic, and attention to detail.
Excellent organizational, time management, and follow up skills.
Strong sense of urgency to effectively complete multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
Verbal and written communication skills which clearly and succinctly communicate across various audience levels.
Ability to work independently or as a team to achieve organizational goals.
Strong active listening skills.
Lift boxes up to 60lbs and move them from one location to another.
Operate a hand pallet jack to move filled pallets of merchandise, up to 1,000 lbs. within the DC.
Pushing merchandise on rolling carts, up to 100 lbs.
Operate forklift using all safety guidelines to retrieve merchandise from upper racks and to move merchandise as needed.
Pick up and appropriately discard all boxes, cartons, and strapping tape to ensure a clean and safe work environment.
Job Requirements
Basic PC skills. Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and Internet Explorer.
Accurately use basic math skills: addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
Understand and follow all safety procedures and guidelines within the D.C.
Work experience in a warehouse environment.
Utilize the STS/RDM system to enter merchandise location into the system.
Able to read and interpret a packing slip, invoice, RF device, etc.
Work Hours and Environment:
Typical work hours for swing shift are Monday through Friday, 2:45pm - 11:15pm
Overtime and weekend work may be required based on business needs.
Work in a warehouse setting and possess the ability to work on your feet throughout the shift
Why You’ll Love Working With Us:
The Product—so good, you’ll be using your employee discount more than you probably should
The People—ask anyone that works here…we have incredible people on our team
The Experience—you’ll enjoy a rewarding career at a respected global children’s brand
The Benefits—health insurance, 401k match, and onsite wellness services for your convenience
Let’s Talk Perks!
Generous Health Savings Account (HSA) employer contributions for individuals and families
Flexible Spending Accounts
Paid holidays and flexible time off
30% off merchandise employee discount (Gymboree & Outlet, Janie and Jack, Crazy 8 & Outlet)
Gymboree Play & Music class discounts
Educational Assistance Development Program
Life insurance (self, spouse/domestic partner, children)
Additional corporate discounts at participating companies

We conduct thorough criminal background checks and drug screens.**

The Site Manager oversees service activities for a major client where local onsite management support is required. This role manages the dispatch of local technical resources in response to service requests and also ensures that client preventive maintenance is accomplished on schedule and that repair services are timely and effective.

This position is responsible for the overall management of all service activities for its client. As such, the incumbent will represent eQuip on all affiliate committees and is responsible to ensure compliance with SLA performance commitments.
Qualifications
Education:
BA/BS degree or equivalent combination of education and experience required.
 Experience/Knowledge/Skills:
Past experience in a service delivery environment is required preferably with supervisory experience. Sales and marketing experience as would normally be achieved in approximately 5 years of experience in medical service marketing is desired. Must have extensive background in at least three of eQuip Tech’s major product lines. Experience in the "third party" service area is required.

Anatomy and Physiology, Life Sciences, selling, negotiation, biomedical equipment and familiarity with regulations such as AAMI, JCAHO, NFPA, OSHPOD, and Title 22.

Incumbent must be familiar with the use of personal computers and various types of software. The incumbent must have excellent communications skills, especially verbal, and demonstrated presentation and negotiation skills. Must be able to work autonomously under the guidance of the eQuip Tech Regional Service Manager. Independence and self direction to anticipate and proactively solve problems, handle difficult circumstances and make sound business decisions is required. Must have a valid California drivers license and driving record acceptable by Sutter's insurance carrier.

Heavy lifting of boxes and supplies up to 40 lbs is required.  May require sitting, standing, stooping, bending and the ability to transport equipment and supplies.
 Must be able to travel throughout California.

For all full-time positions, we offer medical, dental, vision, flex spending, 401K, an anniversary bonus, and an on-the-spot recognition program.  We promote from within our company! You can start with little, to no, security experience and become one of Allied Universal’s many success stories.
 Apply to join the LARGEST SECURITY COMPANY in the United States!
Job Description
The Security Site Supervisor will supervise and coordinate the delivery of quality services to an assigned customer. Act as a liaison between customer, Operation Manager and security officers. Supervise site staff, providing coaching, recognition and discipline within approved empowerment range.
Supervisory Responsibilities
Communicates staffing needs to Operation Manager which may include using the Requisition process, assisting in identifying and interviewing quality candidates
Assures that officers receive appropriate training, developing them in both technical and professional skills; also includes performance management (coaching, counseling, disciplining, performance evaluations, recognition, etc.)
Assures that employee grievances are heard with help from appropriate branch or region HR support employees
Assists with the communication of policies, company announcements and job openings
Provides the basis of a great place to work by treating staff with respect
Enforcement of Contract Standards
Helps Operations Manager identify, meet and exceed the needs of the customer
Meets all contractual scheduled hours with a minimum of unbilled overtime
Coordinates and/or conduct site-specific OJT, client specific training and annual refresher training for security personnel
Reconciles security logs against shift responsibilities and patrols; review incident reports prior to submitting to manager and coordinate preliminary investigations
Performs account audits and off-hour visits, completing required documentation
Manages uniforms, equipment, supplies and vehicles utilized at the account, maintaining appropriate inventories and maintenance checklists
Administrative Management
Administers site safety programs outlining site-specific hazards for security officers including vehicle / driving safety as appropriate to corporate procedures
Prepared to participate in unemployment hearings
Capably utilizes scheduling and billing software, and to produce reports (such as Scheduling Activity, Training Detail reports, etc.) that require interpretation and action for effective business management
Enforces Allied Universal’s policies as outlined in the handbooks and executive memos
Physical and Mental Functions:
Stand or walk constantly (for up to an entire shift) on various surfaces (tile, concrete, carpet)
Climb stairs, ramps, or ladders occasionally during shift
Occasionally bend/twist at waist/knees/neck to perform various duties
Occasionally lift or carry up to 40 pounds
Run as needed
Constant use of both hands and arms in reaching/handling/grasping/fingering while using phone, notepad, writing reports, and other administrative tasks
Constant use of eyes (correctable vision to normal level required) to observe, read, interact with public and co-workers, view security monitors; includes hand/eye coordination
Work in various environments including adverse outdoor conditions such as cold, rain or heat;
Constant mental alertness and attention to detail required while setting priorities and following up on assignments
Qualifications/Requirements:
Qualified applicants for the Security Site Supervisor position will meet the minimum requirements, as described below:
High school diploma or equivalent required
At least 21 years of age
Must possess effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel and the general public in a professional and effective manner; must be able to use initiative and independent judgment within established guidelines
Must be able to frequently prepare written reports and logs in neat, legible handwriting; may require computer skills
Must be able to read and understand all operating procedures and instructions
Must be able to obtain a valid Guard License as required in the state for which you are applying
As a condition of employment, employee must successfully complete a background investigation and a post-offer/pre-employment drug/alcohol test and may be required to pass Driver’s Record check
As a condition of continued employment, employee must maintain current active status of all required License at all times, and must carry the license at all times while on duty
Must display exceptional customer service and communication skills
Remain flexible to ever changing environments; adapt well to different situations
Intermediate computer skills to utilize innovative, wireless technology at client specific sites
Ability to maintain satisfactory attendance and punctuality standard;
Neat and professional appearance
Ability to provide quality customer service
Ability to handle both common and crisis situations at the client site, calmly and efficiently
Read, understand and clearly speak English; constantly use speech and hearing (correctable to normal level required) in communicating with public/co-workers, giving and receiving instructions, using phones
Must be able to handle pressure of working with high volume general public (constantly to occasionally depending on assignment)
 Closing
Allied Universal provides unparalleled service, systems and solutions to the people and business of our communities, and is North America’s leading security services provider. With over 140,000 employees, Allied Universal delivers high-quality, tailored solutions, which allows clients to focus on their core business. For more information: 866.825.5433 or www.AUS.com.
We proudly support the Veteran Jobs Mission, a group of over 200 companies that have committed to collectively hiring a total of one million military veterans.
EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability Allied Universal Services is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce.

column2: Warranty / Delivery Driver – For Construction Materials and Finished Products
column5:
We're recruiting for an experienced Handy Man/Delivery Driver to be part of our team providing high-quality Tuff Shed products at our Sacramento Factory.
DO YOU HAVE WHAT IT TAKES TO BE A SUCCESSFUL HANDY MAN/DELIVERY DRIVER AT TUFF SHED?
- Experience with delivery driving but equally suited to do on-site touch ups and product warranty repair
- Independent multi-tasker with a history of on-the-job reliability
- Great customer service! You'll representing the Tuff Shed's brand and product to customers
- Pride in having a proven safe driving record and accomplishments while operating Flat Bed Trucks, Box Trucks and/or Towing Trailers
- Building relationships with our Installer Crews
- Keen eye for details, whether following shipping instructions or completing warranty repairs
- Experience working as a team to accomplish goals and projects able to be a contributor to do whatever it take to get the job done
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
- Experience as a 'Big Box' delivery driver of product goods is definitely a plus
- Computer skills experience with Microsoft (Word and Excel) and the interest in learning new programs
- Knowledge of basic construction including painting, leveling, roofing/re-roofing, window installation/replacement & 2x4 framing/re-work
- Ability to pass a DOT physical and obtain a Drivers Medical Card
- Ability to safely and efficiently load, unload and transport materials and product
- Experience with pre-trip/post-trip Vehicle Inspections and Record-of-Duty Status logs
- Ability to manage a flexible work schedule
- MUST be reliable, history of being on-time and dependable
- Must possess a current valid driver's license and a satisfactory Motor Vehicle Report
- Must successfully pass a criminal background check and drug screening
- If selected, must be able to pass and complete all requirements of the DOT/FMCSA Qualified Driver Program
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
You'll have the opportunity to join a successful company, and be part of the growth team! On-the-job training. We have several different work areas and we love to cross-train our employees.
Great benefits including paid vacation, paid holidays, medical/dental/vision and life insurance, and a 'Safe Harbor' 401(k) plan.
ABOUT TUFF SHED
Founded on an entrepreneurial spirit and an unwavering commitment to quality, Tuff Shed was established in 1981, and has since developed into America's largest manufacturer and installer of storage buildings and garages, having built more than one million buildings for satisfied customers. We utilize cutting edge green technology in our materials and manufacturing processes, hold multiple U.S. Patents, and are an approved GSA vendor.
NEXT STEPS
- Learn more about us! Check out the Tuff Shed Website at www.TUFFSHED.com.
- Interested? We encourage you to submit an application for consideration
Tuff Shed, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veteran

The Meritage Homes Internship program allows driven college/grad students the opportunity to gain experience with a National New Home Builder leading to possible future opportunities within the Meritage Homes family.  You will work in an environment that fosters learning and allows you to take responsibility to help our team lead the way in our Green Building initiatives.  The internship program uses your pursuit of education to drive you to a company where you can take your in class learning to hands-on applications.  Meritage will work with your school schedule, because we value education as much as you do. You will work side by side with top professionals and executives as you start your career.
 The Construction Intern will manage the new home construction process within assigned communities.  Responsible for ensuring homes are delivered within specific cycle time and budget targets as well as customer quality expectations when closed.  Responsible for maintaining customer satisfaction goals and providing needed customer care/warranty services in assigned communities.
 The Construction Intern will work with and learn: 
The permitting and building inspection process through the local jurisdiction(s)
Building plans, materials and specifications
All Meritage processes required to build our homes
Proper scheduling and quality improvement systems
Storm water pollution prevention and safety programs
Customer satisfaction programs including all customer points of contact
The Meritage Green System
The Meritage Customer Service program

Currently enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters degree program in Construction Management
Strong academic record
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Computer skills in MS Office applications
Ability/Desire to work in a team environment
This is a 3-month temporary field position taking place during the summer. This intern must be flexible to work at any of our locations throughout the summer. 

Are you looking for an amazing career opportunity? Well, look no further! Meritage Homes offers a variety of different careers and is dedicated to building beautiful, environmentally friendly homes, that give our customers the most memorable moments with their loved ones. We are the first top 10 homebuilder to make every home 100% ENERGY STAR® certified, creating a safe and controlled environment for everyone. If you have a self-starter mindset and want to be a part of something great, come join a company that helps people live happier, healthier lives.
 When joining Meritage Homes, you and your career can benefit in several ways, including:
A work environment that encourages creativity and innovative ideas from every level
An organization that lives by its core values everyday
Maintaining a consistent competitive drive to be the best
A competitive pay structure
Phenomenal benefits
State of the art technology to provide an optimal working environment
Flexibility in work-life balance
Having pride in delivering a quality product that benefits people and the environment
The opportunity to further your career in a growing national organization
Team atmosphere where every individual is considered a vital asset

Build your career with TopBuild, where talent meets opportunity! TopBuild Corp. (NYSE: BLD) is the leading installer and distributor of insulation products to the United States construction industry, based on revenue. We provide insulation installation services nationwide through our TruTeamSM business, which has over 190 installation branches located in 43 states; we distribute insulation and other building products nationwide through our Service Partners business from our 72 distribution centers located in 35 states; and we are a leader in building science through TopBuild Home Services, Inc. and its Environments For Living program. TopBuild’s corporate headquarters is located in Daytona Beach, FL.
Our Core Values:Safety - Integrity - Diversity - Customer Focus - Continuous Improvement - Innovation - High Performance Teams
Job Summary: The Installed Products Specialist is responsible for all aspects of installing company products according to work order, manufacturer, quality and safety guidelines. Products include insulation, fireplaces, gutters, mirrors and shelving, garage doors, windows, shower enclosures, home wrap and any other products sold by the company. The Installed Products Specialist is also responsible for observing and following all OSHA and Company Safety policies and procedures.
Benefits: We promote an environment that offers a challenge, creates opportunities, fosters enthusiasm, maximizes full potential and rewards talent. We realize our employees are our most valued resource which is why we offer a variety of benefits including competitive compensation, comprehensive health, dental, vision coverage, paid holidays, paid time off, 401 (k) retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, employee assistance program services, flexible spending account (FSA), life insurance, short term and long term disability, discounted gym membership and a host of other discounts. Our goal is to promote a healthy work/life balance.
TopBuild Corp is an equal opportunity employer. EOE Protected Veterans/Disability
Please visit our website at: www.truteam.com
High school diploma or equivalent

Special Certification or Licensing:
- Valid Driver's License

Legal Age Requirements:
- At least 18 years of age

Type of Travel Required:
- Regional - Daily
Amount of Travel Required:
- 10%
Industry Specific (Construction, Insulation, Trades, etc.)
Additional/Preferred Experience:
1-3 years construction experience preferred.
