column2: Project Manager IV - Construction - Travis AFB
column5:
Requisition Number 17-0422
Post Date 12/4/2017
Title Project Manager IV - Construction - Travis AFB
City Sacramento
State CA
Description
Experienced infrastructure and staff to provide support. Industry-leading Quality, Environmental, Health and Safety resources.  High caliber design team.  Management that encourages you to realize your fullest potential. And, the ability to take ownership! This is what you can look forward to if you join our team.
When coming to work at J&J Worldwide Services, you will be joining more than just a company; you will be joining a family that takes great pride in serving the men and women of the US Military and other government agencies.  With our unique culture, we are proud to say that 40 percent of our employees have been a part of the J&J family for over 10 years and 30 percent for over 20 years.  All of our Project Managers receive support and developmental training.  Project Managers also have access to the full infrastructural support and industry-leading resources our organization has to offer, providing all the tools necessary to ensure successful project performance.
We want you to know that we are committed to providing a successful and rewarding working environment for all of our employees. Our compensation program is designed to be market competitive and we are proud to offer a comprehensive benefit package that provides valuable protection for employees and their families at a reasonable cost.
General Summary
Position works under minimal supervision of either the Construction Division Director or the Program Manager. This is the highest-level project manager position, and it is responsible for managing other Project Managers and administrative staff. This position is typically assigned to large or multiple, highly complex projects and performs a variety of high level construction project management functions on all activities associated with assigned operations and construction projects.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Own the overall life-cycle management and coordination of the project and be the central point of contact for the Government.
Possess intimate working knowledge of the project requirements and be able to anticipate and control risks related to design, construction, outfitting and transition.  Ensure adequate internal controls and review procedures
Perform construction and project management administration functions. Prepare and analyze project fund status reports, reviews billing procedures and contractual requirement submittals
Assist with the development, implementation and documentation of an effective quality control plan in accordance with the contract and SOW terms and conditions
Ensure Safety program is implemented for the site and be knowledgeable in all Federal and State safety requirements for the project location
Monitor project work plans designed to accomplish contractual objectives and provide direction and support for all level Project/Site Construction Managers
Work with corporate Scheduler and Lead Estimator as required to ensure project is delivered on-time and under budget
Develop agendas for both pre and post-job conferences
Develop visual presentations for meetings
Own the budgets and the integrity of contract pricing for assigned operations and projects
Assist in the analysis of new projects for consistency with proposals and negotiations. Reconcile inconsistencies between proposals and new projects and analyze the effects of proposed project changes. Provide management assistance with coordination and negotiation of project changes
Prepare customer correspondence concerning project commitments, modifications and change orders
Keep compliant on Government regulations and commercial trends
Monitor the project progress toward achieving company affirmative action goals with the Corporate Human Resources Department.  Ensure personnel actions within the project comply with wage and salary standards
Prepare and provide input to project both project and company budget requirements
Negotiate key agreements on all assigned projects
Provide direction on staffing related issues; approve all staffing requests, give final approval of new hires for assigned projects
Work directly with Corporate Human Resources regarding employee complaints, performance issues, salary increases and employee terminations
Oversee and maintain all employee training
Other duties as assigned
Knowledge, Experience and Skill Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Business Administration, Accounting, Engineering or a related field and ten years’ experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job
At least ten (10) years Project Management experience in healthcare or government construction industry preferred
Experience in coordinating transition space including staff moves and overseeing the installation of medical and specialty equipment
Understanding of the complexity of working in a hospital or clinical environment, including assuring life safety and infection control risks are always addressed
Highly experienced in Government contracting, general construction and financial administration
Knowledge of U.S. Government procurement regulations and labor laws
Must pass OSHA 10-hour safety course, OSHA 30-hour certification preferred
Must pass Corps of Engineers CQM class for contractors
Must pass ASHE HCC certification class
Excellent management and employee relations skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to handle sensitive and confidential matters
Ability to work independently and recommend solutions to problems
Knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Projects
Superior attention to detail
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while attending to multiple tasks and demands
Ability to travel 10-20% of the time
Work Environment
Occasional and/or light lifting required
Limited exposure to elements such as heat, cold, noise, dust, dirt, chemicals, etc., but none to the point of being disagreeable
May involve minor safety hazards where likely result would be cuts, bruises, etc.
This job description is subject to change by the employer as the needs of the employer and requirements of the job change.
We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.  
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

United States of America - California, Sacramento
 
 **Job Summary**
 
 AECOM is actively seeking a creative, highly talented Inspector, Tunnel & Shaft Construction for immediate employment for the Sacramento, CA office.
 
 The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:
 
 + Relies on experience and independent judgment to guide, document and achieve requirements of Plans and Specifications by construction contractor(s).
 
 + Works under the supervision/direction of Client’s designated Consultant Representative to implement the Construction Contract.
 
 + Reports to the Consultant Project Construction Manager (CM), or Resident Engineer (RE); if a Lead, or Chief, Inspector is designated; reports thru the Lead Inspector)
 
 + Reads and interprets construction contact Plans, Specifications, Project Schedules and Safety Plans.
 
 + Follows Client’s Const. Management Procedures as provided and explained by the CM/RE Consultant lead
 
 + Responsible for monitoring conformance to quality, performance, specifications, and/or code requirements by performing inspection duties.
 
 + Tracks quality assurance progress.
 
 + Performs daily field inspections and maintains inspection records, written and photographic.
 
 + Attends/participates in progress meetings, daily, weekly or monthly as appropriate for the work that is underway.
 
 + Attends Contractor’s site safety meetings and routine activity work planning meetings
 
 + Verifies contractor’s work Submittals have been “accepted” and are in place and understood, prior to work commencement
 
 + Verifies Contractor compliance with accepted Submittals.
 
 + Verifies that Contractor is performing the work according to approved Project Schedules
 
 + Reviews Contractor’s detailed weekly look-ahead schedules for inconsistencies or need for modification/adjustment.
 
 + Reviews and verifies Contractor work activity Safety Plans, and Contractor performance of safe work practices.
 
 + Assists RE & QA coordinator with planning, scheduling and call-out of routine, or specialty testing and inspection by “outside” technical CM sub-contractors.
 
 + Works with Client’s Operations supervision, and crews, in joint, coordinated, performance and completion of the construction work; coordinating cooperation between Contractor and Operations.
 
 + Participates in developing punch lists, verification of testing and commissioning
 
 + Provides input to documentation for turnover of completed Work and equipment turnovers
 
 **Minimum Requirements**
 
 + 5+years of Verifiable heavy construction supervision and inspection experience, including 3-5 years of underground work experience (Tunnel & Shaft work).
 
 + Spoken and written English language Communication skills, at or above the high school level; with the ability to prepare written work documentation reports.
 
 + Proven ability and experience reading, interpreting and performing work from construction contract Plans & Specifications.
 
 + Experience on at least one (1) construction project inspecting and documenting work performance by contractor employees, either as Contractor’s QC Inspector, or as an Owner’s Representative.
 
 + Ability to perform basic communication tasks on computers, and prepare daily documentation records and reports in an electronic format, including inspection photographs.
 
 **Preferred Qualifications**
 
 + Experience with the tools, equipment and materials used in underground construction; hands on experience as a miner, working underground is preferred.
 
 + OSHA 30 hour Construction Safety Certification and basic First-aid & CPR training.
 
 **What We Offer**
 
 AECOM is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes AECOM a great place to work and grow. AECOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
 
 At AECOM, employee's safety and security are our top Safeguarding core value. All employees are expected to set the highest level of safety expectation in their work, display the highest level of safe behavior, and actively participate in AECOM's Safety For Life Program. SH&E is a part of our company culture and participation is required for all employees.

Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of AECOM._

Construction Loss Control Specialist- Boca Raton-43954
Description
Arthur J. Gallagher Co., one of the world's largest insurance brokers, provides a full range of retail and wholesale property/casualty (P/C) brokerage and alternative risk transfer services globally, as well as employee benefit brokerage, consulting, and actuarial services in the United States. We also offer claims and information management, risk control consulting, and appraisal services to clients around the world.
Arthur J. Gallagher Risk Management Services, Inc. is the U.S. retail property/casualty brokerage division of Arthur J. Gallagher Co. Our advisors specialize by industry and coverage types—developing solutions uniquely tailored to individual client requirements. We deliver a full range of insurance and risk management products and services, including traditional and loss-sensitive coverages, captives, alternative risk solutions, and financial products to clients around the world. For additional information, please refer toCareer Opportunitieswith Arthur J. Gallagher Co.

Position Summary:
The ConstructionLoss Control Specialistconducts on-site loss prevention reviews, loss safety planning for assigned accounts and functions as a safety consultant.The Loss Control Specialist will also provide risk control construction services to clients by being ansite LossControl consultant for client construction projects.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Conduct safety observation/audits and site surveys of contractor/subcontractors on client sites.
Develop and conduct training programs for selected clients/contractors as well as risk control services products, such as newsletters, risk
control handbooks, procedures and information safety bulletins.
Develops information on client accounts regarding claims analysis, loss trends, and other specific technical areas.
Reviews and interprets client claims data, providing summaries to Loss Control Associates or client.
Uses industry formulas and calculations to create models to illustrate Loss Control needs and monitor historical loss trends.
Prepares spreadsheets, graphics, charts, diagrams and other illustrative tools to be used for presentations.
Working independently with limited supervision, provides clients and prospects with loss prevention and risk analysis intended to positively impact their loss ratio and premium levels.
May independently complete smaller or less complex loss control analyses and/or may support senior staff with highly complex loss control projects/analyses.
Qualifications
Required:
Bachelor's degree and 1 year related experience required.
Licensed in all states where business is conducted.
Desired:
Degree in safety or science discipline.
Experience with construction safety.
Work Traits:
Good interpersonal and verbal and written communication skills.
U.S. Eligibility Requirements:
Interested candidates must submit an application and resume/CV online to be considered
Must be 18 years of age or older
Must be willing to submit to a background investigation; any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation
Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States. Temporary residence does not include those with non-immigrant work authorization (F, J, H or L visas), such as students in practical training status. Exceptions to these requirements will be determined based on shortage of qualified candidates with a particular skill.Gallagher will require proof of work authorization
Must be willing to execute Gallagher's Employee Agreement or Confidentiality and Non-Disclosure Agreement, which require, among other things, post-employment obligations relating to non-solicitation, confidentiality and non-disclosure
Gallagher offers competitive salaries and benefits, including: medical/dental/vision plans, life and accident insurance, 401(K), employee stock purchase plan, educational expense reimbursement, employee assistance program, flexible work hours (availability varies by office and job function) training programs, matching gift program, and more.
Gallagher believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity and does not discriminate against nor favor any applicant because of race, color, religion, sex, age, veteran status, disability, national origin, or any other legally protected status. Equal employment opportunity will be extended in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, layoff, and termination. In addition, Gallagher will make reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified applicant with a disability, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.

column2: Site Safety Manager for Industrial Painting/Specialty Coating Company
column5:
Company Overview
Headquartered in Southern Oregon, F.D. Thomas, Inc. ("FDT") was founded in 1979 and is one of the nation's largest specialty services contractors. FDT performs commercial and industrial painting, waterproofing, roofing, infrastructure restoration and other specialty services. FDT has offices across the West Coast and provides expert service for major industrial facilities, commercial building owners, government agencies and entertainment/sports complexes. Since inception, the management and workforce of FDT have embraced the company's value equation of Great People Great Work = Extraordinary Company, in the process earning a reputation as a value-added service provider.
This position is for NBAF in Manhattan, KS
Position Overview
Responsible for safety supervision of the field crew during their daily job assignments. Supporting the Site PM & Corporate Safety Manager to ensure personnel, materials, equipment and work environments achieve safety effectiveness and elimination or reduce the number and severity of on-the-job accidents and injuries.
Under the direction of the Corporate EHS Manager the Site Safety Manager will work closely with the Site Project Manager on daily safety issues, training, investigations, compliance, etc.
Some Key Objectives include:
Educate, train, and provide support to operations in the development and execution of consistent safety and environmental management programs for a large site.
Direct accident investigation programs, develop accident trends, and develop programs for improving performance.
Lead the investigation of accidents and injuries, and cooperate in the preparation of material for hearings and insurance investigations.
Ensure compliance with all safety and environmental programs.
Direct a proactive safety and environmental program.
Improve the quality of safety and environmental management processes following established regulations, policies, standards, and practices.
Job Responsibilities:
Supervise daily work crew of 30-50 field personnel
Anticipate, Recognize, Evaluate and Mitigate Safety & Health factors in the workplace
Provide field personnel with timely interpretation in support of resolution of field issues
Evaluate & Update Job Safety Analysis (JSA) for accuracy
Evaluate Site Hazards and develop JSA and Task Specific Lift and Fall Protection Plans
Conduct and Participate daily & weekly tool box and safety meetings
Provide mentoring to field personnel in regards to safety & health
Accident and incident investigation & reporting occurring to all employees, visitors, subcontractors and others
Immediately correct any unsafe condition; document and advise proper chain of command
Ensure appropriate follow-through for any safety related infraction
Provide assistance to establish priorities and procedures to correct any safety violation
Maintain a system for reporting, monitoring and correcting all safety problems. Document all issues and corrective actions taken
Assists in preparing safety policies and procedures; implement all policies and procedures
Participates and advises the Corporate Safety Committee and maintains close communication with administration in matters of safety requiring management action
Perform daily jobsite inspections for any conditions that pose potential safety problems. Document all inspections.
Enforce Safety requirements and disciplinary action as needed
Assist the Corporate Office & Site Personnel with establishing and maintaining an effective Safety & Health Program
Perform Safety & Health Assessments of work activities
Assist management with Safety & Health Compliance concerns
Evaluate Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and Systems for adequacy
Maintain Employee Safety & Health Records
Key Requirements - What You Will Bring to the Team:
5 years of experience in similar role, preferably in the Industrial Construction environment
Basic service line technical fundamentals in painting, waterproofing, roofing and infrastructure restoration
Bilingual in English and Spanish
Natural ability to collaborate well with others across the organization
Strong analytical and organizational skills. Exceptional attention to details
Outstanding work ethic, ability to perform under pressure, meet deadlines, ability to prioritize and deliver multiple tasks on time
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Good computer skills
Good problem solving skills, intellectual maturity, and relationship management skills
Education & Experience:
Bachelor's degree in safety, industrial hygiene, or a related field of study or equivalent experience.
Licenses & Certifications:
N/A
Safety Certifications:
Must have a comprehensive knowledge of OSHA regulations for the construction industry
OSHA 500
Travel:
Possible travel, probably less than 10%

Job Summary:
As a project manager (Architectural/Engineering design), you will work in our Roseville, CA office and remotely at project sites or other offices as needed to manage design projects to meet our clients’ business needs.  The successful candidate will work with other Architects, engineers, designers and other technical professionals to manage facility MEP design build (or design, bid, build) projects for pharmaceutical, biotechnology, advanced technology (semi-conductor), food & beverage as well as other industrial operations.
 Required is a candidate with some past experience as an industrial design Architect, prior to current Project Manager Position.  Many of our projects require basic architectural guidance of clients and design development.  This experience in architecture will be used as the foundation from which multi-disciplined designs are then developed.
Responsibilities:
Project Manager is responsible for facility and utility design projects for manufacturing and distribution clients (food, beverage, wine, beer & spirits and/or consumer products manufacturing project design experience desired).
Any current or past field architectural project management experience is highly desired
Plant engineering experience is a plus
Experience executing projects within an A/E design firm is highly desired.
Exposure to a broad range of engineering disciplines is relevant, including; industrial structures, mechanical systems (refrigeration, chillers, boilers, plumbing, compressed air and HVAC systems) and power distribution.
Requirements:
Minimum 7+ years of experience as an Architect with some recent Project Management responsibilities, project execution including; schematic design, design development, construction documents, contract documents and construction administration services.
The Project Manager will manage project timelines, budget, change and risk throughout the project execution, from concept through design completion.
Overseeing the preparation of plans, specs and contract documents
Administering building construction design, solving building design problems through client and design team interface
Coordinates client needs and requests with ensuring requirements of all state and federal standards and codes are met
Prepare proposals, participate in sales presentations
Manage project timelines and finances throughout the project execution.
Project skills developing specifications, interfacing with and coordinating multidiscipline teams, both on-site and remotely, particularly in private industry with industrial structures.
Interfacing and coordinating with local authorities having jurisdiction. Reviewing, interpreting and applying the code in compliance with the application.
Administering building construction; client interface; and solving design coordination details.
Must possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills for formal presentations, maintain client relationships and interact with our valued team members.
Strong computer skills including Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, Microsoft Project and, AutoCAD.  Revit experience is highly desirable.  
Specific Candidate Skills:  RA, Architect, Job Captain, architectural design, A&E,  Project Manager, BArch, construction, AutoCAD, Revit,
Travel: Flexibility for travel is required. 20-50% travel on a sporadic basis to support installation and start-up activities.  The majority of this travel will be regional to project sites, and to collaborate with design professionals in other offices, for training and other purposes. Relocation:  We are looking for candidates local to the area.   For highly qualified applicants outside of the local area some relocation assistance is available.
Education:
BArch degree or BS degree in Architectural Engineering is required.
 RA or AE Licensure /Registration is required

Summary: Sell Rust-Oleum Roof Coatings to and through our distributor network as well as provide localized technical support. Also work closely with contractors, focused on the roof coatings line, to ensure that Rust-Oleum and the contractor are providing the best solutions, the best products and the best installations to our customers. Responsible for the set-up and maintenance of our distributor network as sellers of the Rust-Oleum Roof Coating line. Cultivate relationship and encourage contractors to purchase Rust-Oleum Roof Coatings through our distributor network.

Ensures safe execution and delivery of all roofing services and operations.
Provides a variety of technical training sessions in the contractor’s office and field applications.
Provide hands on application training and supervision of roof coatings and installation.
Performs roof inspections and generates written reports on condition analysis, photo documentation, recommendation and material budget estimates.
Communicates professionally with our customers, distributors, Rust-Oleum sales representatives, national account executives and corporate staff.
Completes weekly/monthly reports, sales activities and proposals.

Peel tests
Product recommendations

Product diagnostic support to ensure proper selection and product usage.

Description
 As a Journeyman Carpenter you will construct, erect, install, and repair structures and fixtures of wood, plywood, metal studs, and drywall using carpenter's hand tools and power tools making sure to conform to local building codes.
Specific responsibilities:
Installing foundations, walls, floors, ceilings, and roofs using materials such as: wood, steel, metal, concrete, plastics, and composites of multiple materials
Fitting and installing window frames, doors, door frames, door hardware, interior and exterior trim using a carpenters level, plumb bob, and laser levels
Erecting scaffolding, ladders for assembling structures above ground levels
Studying specifications in blueprints, sketches, or building plans to prepare project layout and determine dimensions and materials required
Shaping or cutting materials to specified measurements, using hand tools, machines, or power saws
Following established safety rules and regulations and maintaining a safe and clean environment
Building or repairing cabinets, doors, frameworks, floors, or other wooden fixtures used in buildings, using woodworking machines, hand tools, or power tools
Assembling and fastening materials to make frameworks or props, using hand tools and wood screws, nails, dowel pins, or glue
Removing damaged or defective parts or sections of structures and repair or replace, using hand tools
Inspecting ceiling or floor tile, wall coverings, siding, glass, or woodwork to detect broken or damaged structures
Requirements
Simply put, we're not a temp agency and don't just hire anyone. In fact, we're highly selective, committed to hiring only those Carpenters that are highly skilled in their trade with unwavering reliability, strong work ethic, and a desire to be the best.
Specific requirements:
4 years of experience in commercial carpentry
Ability to comprehend schematic diagrams, blueprints, sketches, building plans and other specifications required by our client for information pertaining to the type of material required to get job done
Experience working with equipment such as: boom lifts, scissor lifts, and forklifts
Strong working knowledge of job site safety as well as ability to complete a company specific safety orientation
High standard of integrity and professionalism
Drug free at all times

Vanir Construction Management, Inc. has been exceeding client expectations for 35 years. Our progressive growth and quality of service has led Vanir to become consistently ranked among the top construction management firms in the nation by Engineering News-Record. As we continue growing into new areas and markets, our focus is to maintain a team of creative, ambitious, and visionary individuals.

The Project Manager provides the planning, coordination, and direction for project management activities to ensure they meet owner needs, specifications, cost, and schedule. Maintains management and project facilitation for the successful completion per compliance, contractual, owner, and Vanir requirements. May supervise office/field administrative staff, Field/Project Engineers, Assistant Project/Construction Managers, and other assigned project staff.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Strong knowledge of project development to include contracts, design, construction management, project systems, delivery, and specifications to ensure relation and compliance to project requirements
Assist with the development of project management opportunities with a focus on healthcare
Participate in sales pursuits
Perform project management services during programming, design, construction and closeout project phases
Primary contact and liaison for owner and principle partner entities for the contract, design, systems, procedures and related deliverables
Develop project specific procedures, documentation, contract, and related A/E systems for the project
Ensure contracts, drawings, estimates, and specifications comply with construction/project requirements
Obtain, maintain, and manage data, information, communications, and approvals required by project and company requirements between Owner, Architects, Engineers, and other project related entities
Represent Owner, Vanir, and related parties in public forums and meetings
Coordinate, direct, and monitor activities of construction management staff, contractors, Engineers, Architects, and related performing entities
Manage project controls, cost, and performance activities and procedures
Lead in project meetings to include documentation, administration, and tracking of relevant information and statuses
Provide management of project logistics, organization, systems, and personnel resources
Ensure project closeout to secure appropriate provisions for final project delivery to owner entities
Provide all services and objectives for the application of Vanir’s quality services
Ensures project team adheres to safety requirements
Manages bid phase services, as may be required by the client
Perform other duties as required
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree with emphasis in technical disciplines such as Engineering, Construction Management, Architecture, or equivalent technical area of study is required, OR equivalent years of experience if not degreed 
7+ years of experience managing projects during the design and construction project phases required
Experience as a Project Manager from beginning to end of at least $2.5M healthcare projects required
Experience managing Design-Bid-Build and Design-Build projects required
OSHPD experience required
A/E solicitation, project development, design-phase management, construction estimating, cost, project controls/scheduling, documentation, engineering/construction principles, contracts and delivery methods are desired
Thorough understanding of contracts, documents, drawings, and specifications and applied experience in the areas of project accounting, cost, administrative, and personnel interaction in professional settings are required
Good oral and written communication skills required
Registration as Architect, Engineer, and/or GC license is desired
Proficiency with various document control systems, as well as new construction and modernization of Healthcare projects are preferred
Confident in project controls
Ability to represent Vanir and related entities in a professional manner at all times to ensure company policies and procedures as well as compliance to all applicable laws and regulations

Are you an experienced Structural Analyst with a classical and/or advanced methods background?

Do you possess the ability to work well independently and in a team environment?

Do you strive for customer satisfaction?

Are you a team player and builder?

If you can answer "yes" to these questions, we want to talk to you!

We are Raytheon Missile Systems and we are seeking several career level Structural Analyst / Engineers to join the Mechanical Subsystems Engineering Directorate (MSD) within Analysis & Test Department. If you are a Structural Analyst willing and you meet the following qualifications, we'd like to speak with you! This position is located in Sacramento, CA.
The Analysis & Test Department of the Mechanical Subsystems Engineering Directorate (MSD) is seeking an analyst for our structural analysis group. The selected candidate will be responsible for detailed structural analysis to support all phases of programs including development and production. The analyses will cover a wide range of difficult problems, requiring solutions that are imaginative, thorough, practicable, and consistent with organization objectives. The analysis tasks will span the spectrum from classical hand analyses to detailed analyses requiring the use of finite element analysis software. The selected candidate will work under general direction and will be expected to define the scope and level of analysis required to meet required objectives and will be held accountable for completing the work within the agreed upon cost and schedule. The candidate will be expected to present their work for peer reviews and to be a peer reviewer for other engineers’ work. The customers of this position will include internal Raytheon personnel and programs as well as external Government(s) personnel and programs.

The selected candidate will work with the customer and engineering leadership to define testing required to validate structural analyses and to verify that hardware is compliant with requirements. In addition, the selected candidate will be expected to plan and support tests, perform data reduction and engage in structural model correlation.


Required Experience & Skills:
· A minimum of eight (8) years of professional experience in structural analysis
· Structural testing: planning, organization, execution, data reduction and correlation
· Proficiency with engineering workstations running Windows and Office suite
· Demonstrated ability to perform Structural Finite Element Analysis using PATRAN, ANSYS or equivalent software
· Expertise performing hand calculations based on fundamental equations
· Ability to manage multiple priorities
· Strong interpersonal skills working in a team environment with positive interaction
· Group management skills, leadership skills, and strong communication skills
· Ability to travel to government and other facilities in support of program activities
· Must currently have or be able to obtain a DoD Secret clearance

· U.S. Citizenship is required

Degree Requirements:
· Bachelor’s degree in Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering or degree in a related field

Desired Experience & Skills:
· Master’s in Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering
· Ten (10) or more years of experience in the Structural Analysis of complex systems that require collaboration of multiple engineering disciplines (such as a weapon system)
· Ability to work independently
· Self-starter

Description:

Posting Details




Position Information


Working Title
Painter

Classification Title
Painter

Job Summary

Under general supervision, incumbent performs the full range of skilled journey-level painting work including: performing maintenance, preventive maintenance, inspection, repairs, installation, renovation and construction of university facilities, fixtures, utilities, and equipment. Performs journey level work independently. Assignments will vary depending on the needs of the campus, but will be in the category of building trades. Performs data entry into the Facility Management Maintenance System(s). Provides inventory and input on tasks improvement, estimates, planning, scheduling, and PM data maintenance. Performs all tasks and duties in accordance with safe work practices and standards.


FLSA
Non-Exempt - This position is covered by health benefits, and is non-exempt, (eligible for overtime compensation) according to the Fair Labor Standards Act.

Classification Salary Range

$5,207 – 6,654 monthly


Hiring Range
$5,207 - 6,654 monthly

Salary Grade/Range
1

Step
N/A

Is this position Hourly or Intermittent?
No

Regular or Temporary
Regular

Full Time or Part Time
Full Time

Pay Plan
12

Work Hours
Monday - Friday - 6:00 a.m. to 2:45 p.m. Alternate shift or work week may be required.

Department Information

Facilities Management is the steward for the University buildings, infrastructure, grounds and landscape. We perform maintenance and renovation to facilities, plan and manage new building construction and support the “Redefine the Possible” initiative through our commitment to building a welcoming campus and by creating a dynamic physical environment for students, faculty, staff, and the community.


Minimum Qualifications

Knowledge: Work requires thorough knowledge of the methods, materials, tools and equipment used in the painting trade including painting, finishing, drywall, and paperhanging; and a thorough knowledge of the applicable state codes and regulations, including the Safety Orders of the Division of Industrial Safety of the State of California.

Abilities: Must be able to apply paints and finishes neatly and accurately; mix paints and finishes and match colors; erect and work from scaffolds, rigging and ladders; select the most appropriate materials; read, interpret and work from blueprints, plans, drawings, and specifications; make rough sketches; estimate cost, time and materials of painting work; maintain records and retrieve data using manual and/or computerized record-keeping systems; prepare standard reports; provide instruction to unskilled and semi-skilled assistants; analyze and respond appropriately to emergency situations; read and write at a level appropriate to the position; and perform arithmetic calculations as required by the position. Incumbents may be required to possess a California Driver’s License valid for the operation of any vehicle or equipment they are required to operate.

Experience: These abilities normally would be acquired through any combination of progressively responsible training and experience which demonstrates achievement of journey-level skills equivalent to that acquired through completion of a standard painter’s apprenticeship program.


Required Qualifications

1. Thorough knowledge of the methods, materials, tools and equipment used in the painter trade;
2. Organizational skills to manage tasks and work load.
3. Excellent customer service skills.
4. Demonstrate and possess the ability to work cooperatively with a diverse population (i.e. campus students, faculty, and staff.
5. Ability to work an alternate shift or work week as needed.
Physical Requirements:
6. Ability to frequently move, transport, or position equipment up to 50 lbs.
7. Ability to wear appropriate Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) as needed.

Job Description

Description
Building a career at Granite may be the most valuable thing you could do...

Are you interested in the opportunity to work for an industry-leading company that will give you the experience and exposure you need to build your career and personal brand? If so, then you’ve come to the right place!

Since 1922, Granite Construction has continued its long standing commitment to building some of America’s largest infrastructure projects including highways, bridges, dams, rail, and power. Recognized as one of the top 25 largest construction companies in the U.S., Granite specializes in complex infrastructure projects and provides award-winning construction services in mining, earthwork, water/sewer, power, tunneling, rail, highway and bridge construction. Granite also produces construction materials-sand, gravel, ready-mix, recycled asphalt product and asphalt concrete, and is a proven leader in alternative procurement project delivery.

General Summary

This position is responsible for land identification, property investigation, project justification, contract negotiation, permitting, and entitlement for assigned resource development projects.


Essential Job Accountabilities


• Work with local and corporate employees to prioritize development needs, development projects, and development efforts that meet company objectives

• Gather and organize data for economic justification to support feasibility of prioritized/approved land/materials ventures

• Facilitate multidisciplinary teams including geologists, attorneys, real estate professionals, engineers and various consultants to secure aggregate reserves and to obtain permits and land use entitlements for future projects and plant operations

• Coordinate and negotiate legal and conditional agreements with land owners and corporate stakeholders to ensure viability of purchase

• Develop and execute entitlement, public relations plan and environmental review processes to accelerate the approval process

• Assist in market research and analysis efforts

At Granite, our employees are our most valued asset and we are passionate about retaining, developing, and recruiting the best talent available. Our employees reflect our core values: Honesty, Integrity, Fairness, Accountability, Consideration of Others, Pursuit of Excellence, Reliability Safety and Citizenshipand we are continuously looking for individuals who possess a winning attitude and share our Core Values. In exchange, we help you build a career that no other company can duplicate. You will be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued. Add our award winning safety program, ethics, reputation, and a commitment to continuous improvement and you’ll see that we are building more than infrastructure—together, we are building your future.


Qualifications

Granite Construction Incorporated is a member of the Samp;P 400 Index and is the parent company of Granite Construction Company, one of the nation's largest heavy civil contractors and construction materials producers. Granite Construction is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, Individuals with Disabilities and a Drug-Free Workplace. Granite Construction, Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Granite") will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Avionics Technician Mobile Service Technician (Bay Area, California)(Job Number: 265451)
Description
 POSITION SUMMARY:
 To work as part the Mobile Service Truck (MST) team, focused on the maintenance activities and work scope of the Customers Citation aircraft.  To install, adjust, functional test, troubleshoot and repair avionics systems on board the aircraft at remote locations. Will assist the MST A&P Technician with reviewing the work scope with Customers and adding squawks as required. Will respond to Customer inquiries and be responsible for assuring Customer satisfaction by coordinating with the Service Center Team. Will assist the MST A&P Technician with overseeing the maintenance of the MST, insuring vehicle is properly serviced and road worthy at all times.
 POSITION RESPONSIBILTIES:
 1.      Performs the functional testing required to isolate a customer complaint in a particular avionics system and repairing that aircraft system in accordance with FAA procedures.
a.      Based on in-flight analysis and/or evaluation of information received from the customer, diagnoses problems and takes corrective action.
b.      Troubleshoots problems on defective units or wiring discrepancies.
c.       Replaces defective units, repairs wiring and modifies. Works from appropriate Textron Aviation schematics, blueprints and service bulletins.
d.      Responsible for final testing of avionics equipment and signing off customer discrepancy sheets.
e.      Ensures all transmitting and receiving equipment (includes pulse equipment) complies with all applicable FCC rules and regulations.
f.        Installs modifications on the aircraft, including wiring build-up and aircraft installations.
2.      As required, accompanies pilot in flight to functional test repaired systems and/or align systems.
 3.      Orders and obtains parts necessary to effect aircraft repairs.  Assures that cores are returned in accordance with established procedure.
 4.      Responsible for communicating safety expectations of the Service Center.
Monitors the work environment to assure it is maintained in a safe and orderly condition.
Identifies and corrects unsafe acts.
 5.      Responsible for continually updating knowledge and staying current on latest avionics developments and equipment to maintain current status of all FCC and FAA repair station licenses.
 6.      Works as a member of a team focused on meeting customer expectations requiring Mechanics and Avionic Technicians to assist each other as required.
 7.      Must possess a Textron Aviation-issued driver license and valid state-issued driver license. Both are required to operate Company-owned vehicles or vehicles under Textron Aviation control. Textron Aviation driver license candidates are required to possess at the minimum, the state requirement for vehicle liability insurance in order to be eligible for a Textron Aviation-issued driver license and a valid state-issued driver’s license.
 8.     Performs related duties as required. 
Qualifications
 EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
 ·         Required:
o   Duties require a broad knowledge of electronics and ability to use all test equipment connected with this field
o   Must have knowledge of the operation of avionics systems including communication, navigation, auto-pilot, flight detector, pulse equipment including DME, transponder, and weather radar.
o   Equivalent to 4 years high school plus a level of training equal to 2 years college or technical school
o   More than 3 years’ experience in aircraft avionics systems, troubleshooting, and repair
   
 INDEED
 EEO Statement Textron is committed to providing Equal Opportunity in Employment, to all applicants and employees regardless of, race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, military status, veteran status, handicap, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law.
Pay Transparency Policy Statement The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise, have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.
Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements, including US Citizenship, for access to classified information.

Job Title Cost Engineer

Street Address 3500 American River Drive
City Sacramento
State/Province California

Purpose PURPOSE
The purpose of this role is to assist Construction area offices in meeting cost objectives.   Specifically, this role collects, prepares, analyzes, and communicates cost data for construction projects; monitors project budgets and costs; oversees and/or prepares billings and payments of project work; prepares and processes financial reporting, and completes special reports and studies as requested.   This role has primary responsibility for the accuracy and timeliness of cost financial reporting.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
-    Actively supports the achievement of Construction goals and objectives by applying expert knowledge of quantitative tools and techniques, cost analysis, budgets, and special reporting to Construction financial reporting efforts.
-    Collaborates across departments and supports consistent technical practices and financial reporting procedures.   Adheres to policies, procedures, and standards that protect the company’s interests.
-    Promotes and protects Teichert’s values including diversity, teamwork, fair work environment and respect of others in order to maintain a “team” spirit within the business and on project teams; works and cooperates with other disciplines across company lines to ensure maximum and best uses of Teichert resources.
-    Promotes and protects the community perception of Teichert.
-    Supports the effectiveness and efficiency of construction business management efforts through constant collaboration with the estimating and field operation components of the company.   Provides the most current and accurate cost and budget information; collects, processes, and analyzes cost data; provides information for gain/loss reporting.
-    Successfully manages the billing and payment process.   Prepares and processes client billings and vendor/subcontractor invoices for payment, and maintains records to verify quantities, prices, payment terms, subcontract, extra work, and other data required for reconciling invoices with payments. Minimizes turnaround on receivables and collectables.   
-    Assists in achieving a zero injury culture through supporting safety programs and actively participating in appropriate safety meetings and training sessions to maintain a safe, healthy work environment and meet corporate safety standards.
-    Builds and maintains positive working relationships with internal and external customers, vendors, and contractors.   Facilitates communication of company, project, and reporting policies.   Maintains a favorable impression of the company with external customers through professional and courteous interactions.
- Gathers feedback and continuously strives to make improvements to day-to-day processes and practices.
-    Responsible for completion of documentation, including files, records, reports and control documents for use in reconciling budgets, gains/loss reporting, aging statements, cost analysis, payables and receivables transactions, extra work billings, change orders, Foreman diaries and/or other as required. Documentation must be adequate to support internal and external audits.
-    Assists in preparing and maintaining up-to-date written guidelines and manuals pertaining to cost analyzing.
-    Regularly coordinates with PMs, superintendents, PE’s, and others to validate/verify costs, quantities, billings, time cards, diaries in order to quickly identify production plan breakdowns and in order to provide visibility of opportunities and risks at the appropriate management level.
-    Routinely visits job sites in order to advance collaboration and to develop first-hand knowledge of job progress.
-    Meets financial, business, and project deadlines.

QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS

Education:
-    Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting (or related field) or equivalent combination of technical training and related experience

Experience & Industry Expertise:
-    5 years’ experience in cost/estimating, construction, accounting, or equivalent combination of technical training and related experience

Specific Job Requirements:
-   Successful completion of a pre-employment drug, alcohol, and background investigation
- Current on all company required safety training
-   Ability to preserve confidential and proprietary information and successfully avoid conflicts-of-interest
-   Knowledge of construction operations
-   Knowledge of General Accounting Principals and resource monitoring techniques, i.e. cost control, procurement, estimating, process systems
-   Strong PC skills using spreadsheet applications
- Knowledge of company’s Standard Operating Policies and Procedures
- Valid Driver’s License

Competencies:
-    Relationship Management
-    Business Acumen
-    Communications
-    Organization and Management
-    People Development
-   Technology:   Microsoft Office , Accounting and Finance Software, Project Management Software
-    Technical competence in business and/or finance

Teichert is an Equal Opportunity Employer and an E-Verify Company.

The Senior Electrical Engineer is responsible for successfully working with client project teams and design team, including designers and CAD operators to create complete designs.  The ideal candidate will have the ability to successfully communicate with department members, general contractors, architects, and other members of assigned projects.
 
Include, but are not limited to the following: 
Project-based supervision, coordination, and review of work for small teams of designers and engineers
Provide technical direction and perform quality control throughout the lifecycle of a project
Initial development and final review of partial or complete electrical construction permit packages, including: Single Line Diagrams and riser diagrams for power, critical routing details and system sizing, preliminary short-circuit and voltage drop calculations, and (potentially) P&ID diagrams
Partial development and review of Fire Alarm, Integrated Systems, and Telecom system permit packages
Development of key project documentation such as: Basis of Design (BOD) and Design Criteria, Sequence of Operations (SOO) for controls, switchgear, PLC, and generator/inverter systems, and commissioning Scope of Work (SOW) and/or Commissioning scripts
Support of overall construction and drawing development initiatives, including: internal coordination with project management, external coordination with owners, Integrated Product Delivery (IPD) teams, vendors, etc., engineering support of sales and estimating efforts, recommendations for new equipment and devices, review of submittal for critical equipment such as switchgear and relays, and visit job sites and facilitate engineering to the field as needed
Facilitate special engineering studies including: complete Short Circuit Analysis (SCA) including developing SCA computer models, determining duty and appropriate AIC ratings of gear and protection devices, adjusting or determining appropriate trip settings for devices, Time Current Coordination (TCC) analysis, and Arc Flash analysis and label creation; and Neher-McGrath (i.e., underground heat) calculations
Assist design/build sales staff with schematic plans for presentation
Support training of Engineers, Designers and CAD Operators

Include, but are not limited to the following: 
P.E. License in California in good standing and capable of registration in other states
BSEE degree from accredited college or university
Minimum of 10 years of experience with building power systems, signal, and telecommunication systems, of which, a minimum of 6 years of experience in a lead position (EOR) within an engineering or similar design firm
Experience must be broad based including mission critical facilities design and industrial design
Extensive knowledge of NEC and building codes as it applies to electrical design, including over-current protection, conductor sizing, conduit fill, derating and clearances
Extensive of lighting and standard commercial/industrial products and their application
In depth knowledge of general construction practices, building types, and electrical construction
Knowledge of signal systems, including telecommunications
Knowledge of electrical drafting symbols, and electrical or general construction basics
Knowledge of electrical components, including NEMA types, area classifications requirements and sizes
Work within established department, utilizing established standards and support software
Accept and apply guidance and direction to support department standards and quality
Communication skills: successfully communicate with Rex Moore project managers, electricians, project members and clients
Acceptable driving record to utilize company vehicles for meetings
Experience utilizing the following software tools: Microsoft Office products such as Excel, Word and Project; Bluebeam and Adobe PDF tools, AutoCAD, AutoCAD MEP, and/or AutoCAD Revit; ETAP and/or SKM PowerTools; AmpCalc, Cyme, or similar heat analysis tools

Kal Krishnan Consulting Services, Inc. (KKCS), a California Corporation, is a full-service engineering & design, construction management, and program management organization. The firm has grown steadily in size and capability since its founding in 1987, and today employs more than 85 professionals in our regional offices. KKCS has attracted to its staff a full complement of highly experienced, talented, and dedicated professionals who bring a collaborative, integrated team approach to our clients projects.
KKCS experience includes work on rail, airports, ports, freeways, schools, universities, facilities, water, wastewater, bridges, and roadways. Our client list includes federal agencies, state agencies, regional agencies, and private clients. KKCS has broad experience and expertise in engineering design, project management and project controls services.
The KKCS culture is rooted in the ideals of integrity, safety, diversity, and ethical business practices, which is a commitment shared by all KKCS employees throughout our offices and project sites around the country. We have a positive impact on the communities we serve by not only improving infrastructure but also providing service at a relatively low cost to the taxpayer. This allows for more money to be available to the agencies we serve, that inevitably will be reinvested in the community. Overview
Who are we looking for as an Equipment Field Service Technician?
Patterson Dental is looking for an independent worker who is interested in the field of bio-medical (dental) device and equipment repair.
Equipment Field Service Technician Overview:
As a Field Service Technician, you provide repair and installation on a variety of dental equipment and products including networking, computers and software in a Windows environment. The Service Technician learns and follows manufacturer guidelines relative to the repair of devices. Training is supplied by mentorship program with other branch technicians, manufacturers, online training courses and the Patterson Technology Center.
Why join Patterson?
Patterson Companies is an industry-leading specialty distributor serving the dental and veterinary supply markets. Driven to meet the needs of healthcare professionals in these growing markets, Patterson provides a total-package approach to doing business.
Our customers benefit from a diverse platform of products and services, as well as the convenience and peace of mind that come with relying on one trusted partner for everything they need.
Responsibilities
Determining parts, supplies or tools needed to complete service requests and using, maintaining, and securing test devices and tools used to adjust, calibrate and repair equipment.
Managing vehicle inventory and restocking as necessary.
Ensuring proper vehicle maintenance guidelines and safe driving habits are followed.
Repairing equipment to meet manufacturer’s specifications as well as all company, OSHA or other agencies’ policies related to asepsis.
Providing technical support after initial installation of equipment, PC software and hardware and ensuring that service commitments are met within standard response time.
Other duties as related to the Equipment Field Service Technician position.
Qualifications

The ideal candidate will possess a minimum of a High School Diploma or equivalent.
General mechanical aptitude with prior experience in the areas of carpentry, plumbing, heating, electricity, and/or electronics is required.
Competencies in the areas of customer service, organization, problem-solving, and interpersonal and communication skills are highly desired.
A valid driver's license and clean driving record is required.
Technical training in the bio-medical or electronics field is preferred.
General computer proficiency, including knowledge of Windows-based programs and experience with peripherals such as printers, backups, scanners and modems is strongly preferred.
What physical capabilities are required?
You must be able to lift up to 100 pounds.

HEAVY EQUIPMENT OPERATOR
At ERRG, we believe that each of our projects are significant and the most critical ingredient for success is our people.  Our people provide the talent, experience and passion that lies at the heart of every one of our projects.  That is why we can provide the challenges and inspiration to help our people grow professionally and personally.
Our ERRG office in Sacramento is seeking a site hire who is self-motivated, independent, dependable and a strong communicator to be a Heavy Equipment Operator.
Summary:
Operate one or several types of power construction equipment, such as excavators, bulldozers, backhoes, compactors, articulated dump trucks, or front-end loaders to excavate, move, and grade earth. Majority of earth-moving activities will be associated with environmental contamination. Operate equipment with both CAT and John Deere controls. Maintain and perform minor equipment repair in addition to other duties.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Learn and follow safety regulations.
Take actions to avoid potential hazards and obstructions, such as utility lines, other equipment, other workers, and falling objects.
Adjust hand wheels and depress pedals to control attachments, such as blades, buckets, scrapers, and swing booms.
Start engines, move throttles, switches, and levers, and depress pedals to operate machines such as bulldozers, trench excavators, wheel loaders, and backhoes.
Locate underground services, such as pipes and wires, prior to beginning work.
Monitor operations to ensure that health and safety standards are met.
Align machines, cutter heads, or depth gauge makers with reference stakes and guidelines or ground or position equipment, following hand signals of other workers.
Load and move dirt, rocks, equipment, and materials, using trucks, shovels, graders, or related equipment.
Drive and maneuver equipment equipped with blades in successive passes over working areas to remove topsoil, vegetation, and rocks, and to distribute and level earth or terrain.
Coordinate machine actions with other activities, positioning or moving loads in response to hand or audio signals from crew members.
Minimum Qualifications:
High school diploma or general education degree (GED).
Five (5) years of experience working as an equipment operator.
Trained and certified to operate the equipment assigned with a minimum of 4 years of equipment specific experience.
Experience following plans and stakes for cut and fill.
Current 40-Hour HAZWOPER or 8-Hour HAZWOPER Refresher.
Experience working on environmental, remediation projects/sites.
Demonstrated experience operating excavators, bulldozers, backhoes, compactors, articulated dump trucks, and front-end loaders.
Ability to travel to project sites.
Must be able to walk/stand 8+ hours/day
Must be able to lift up to 50lbs on a regular basis.
Preferred Qualifications:
Minimum four (4) years of work experience at environmental construction sites.
Experience working on military construction projects.
ERRG is proud to be an affirmative action / equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, creed, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected under local, state or federal laws.

The Construction Project Manager is principally responsible for managing contract resources for all phases of construction for major projects. This would include overseeing the contractors for schedule, quality and cost / budget during all phases of construction projects at new and existing facilities, from inception to completion.
Also, this position will entail developing a detailed scope of work, creating alternative solutions with cost estimates, project planning and putting together detailed bid specifications for construction contracts, documenting bids, selecting vender and awarding contracts. Frequent oversight will be required for progress on cost and schedule on all open contracts with close monitoring of quality and performance. Responsibility for coordinating and scheduling activities to minimize disruptions to production and store operations.
Qualifications include retail / commercial / storm water/ infrastructure/ facility construction project management experience, a successful track record handling multiple contracts ranging from $10,000 to over $1,000,000 skilled in use of excel, water project management / design tools, strong organizational and communication skills, demonstrated process improvement successes, the ability to clearly identify issues and provide workable solutions with a strong attention to detail.
Essential Functions:
Manage individual new construction and renovation projects for various concepts. Ability to read and decipher construction drawings.
Responsible for, but not limited to; review of plans for accuracy, preparation of scopes of work, review of pre site investigation reports for completeness of content and coordination with plans. Prepare bidder list, coordinate distribution, review, clarify and negotiate final contract price. Provide regular reporting on project status and performance metrics.
Prepare necessary contract documents and internal Authorization for Expenditures for signature.
Coordinate construction schedule and prepare necessary required purchase orders required under construction contract documents and manage project budgets, assist as required in obtaining regulatory approvals and permitting.
Inspect construction job site projects for progress performance, as needed, and verify that construction is within the scope of contract documents and in general meets accepted trade standards and local/state governing authorities.
Manage and coordinate schedules for vender /subcontractors deliveries and verify quality and quantity of goods that are required for installation.
Review contract violations/contract additions or deletions with outside contractors and prepare necessary documents to complete projects.
Prepare/maintain required construction project management administration, documentation and reporting per company requirements.
Prepare necessary purchase orders for completion of construction projects and verify payments using a computerized database program.
Respond to any and all construction related issues until project is turned over to operations management.
Performs other related duties, as assigned.
Initiate and provide walk-through inspections of current construction projects to monitor progress, assuring coordination between all contracted personnel and adherence to site safety plans and environmental containment provisions. Documentation of non-conformance is required.
Communicate schedules and coordinate all work with operations teams so not to adversely impact store operations.


Required Skills
Physical Activities Required to Perform Essential Functions:
Ability to stand, walk, and sit up for long periods of time. Manual dexterity to reach and handle items with hands and arms; Climb and balance, bend, twist, kneel, crouch, lift, carry, push and pull over 50 pounds occasionally; Ability to talk or hear; Peripheral and depth perception vision; Light to moderate physical activity performing non-strenuous daily activities of a productive/technical nature. Visual acuity for inspection of close detailed material such as reports, manuals, documents, blueprints, engineering schematics, computer work, and construction project inspection.
Job Conditions:
Occasional exposure to an outdoor and indoor shop environment with adequate ventilation. Occasional exposure to the outdoor weather conditions. Exposure to moderate noise levels (example: business office environment with computers and printers, light traffic) and occasional exposure to high noise levels from construction and production equipment. Physical hazards are present due to the equipment and machinery used throughout the scrap yard and the presence of scrap itself


Required Experience
Qualifications:
Construction project management experience managing commercial construction projects, working with plans and specifications, schedules and negotiating price.
Experience in working with subcontractors and vendors and managing schedules in order to meet deadlines.
Contract documentation, contract review and financial accounting experience required.
Knowledge of acceptable trade standards at local and state levels in order to obtain government approvals.
Ability to prepare construction schedules, purchase orders and other documentation as needed.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Visio, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Project or other Project Management software. Also experience with CAD software is desirable.
Team player with excellent project management skills and the ability to follow through to completion.
Bachelor's degree in building construction or engineering or equivalent work experience.
Ability to travel 50-75% to various project locations.
6 years of previous experience.

Responsible for capital improvement and non-capital maintenance projects of medium scope and complexity. Projects typically involve budgets between $400,000 and $3 million individually or in aggregate. Responsible for multiple projects in a fast-paced environment and may involve substantial architectural and utility system impacts and may require Chancellor approval. Responsible for the direction of design and engineering professionals of multiple disciplines; require original needs assessment and use programming, and may include technology and/or complex engineering. Accountable for all project phases from inception and use programming, through design and contracting, to final completion of construction, and represent the campus throughout the process. Manage and execute projects with primary responsibility, or manage elements of larger projects under a higher level project manager. Bachelor's degree in related area and /or equivalent experience/trainingExtensive experience managing architectural and engineering capital and non-capital projects of medium scope and complexity, including direct responsibility for the leadership of project teams and the development and management of overall project budgets and schedules. Knowledge of project management, architecture and building/facility systems through acquisition of a degree from an accredited curriculum in architecture/engineering or extensive experience in planning and management of construction modification and renovation of buildings, facilities and physical plant systems and equipment. Construction administration experience to monitor contractor operations for conformance to contract documents and applicable codes, review and negotiate contractor claims, to oversee the work of inspectors and testing agencies and to actively assist project team in the resolution of technical and procedural challenges. Demonstrated experience with design and construction contracts, contract law and construction claims procedures. Leadership and management skills necessary to lead project committees and manage large and complex professional teams. Oral and written communication skills to effectively present project issues and design submittals to the campus leadership and to prepare clear, concise and professional reports and correspondence. Knowledge of architectural, engineering and construction practices; familiarity with California and applicable building codes and regulations; and experience directing the preparation of programming and design documents, reviewing and approving construction documents and contractor submittals and resolving field issues during construction. Knowledge of current project and construction costs and experience with industry standard cost estimating systems. Financial skills to prepare, monitor and manage detailed project budgets, evaluate independent cost estimates, and review and approve payment requests. Knowledge of typical design and construction sequences and durations necessary to prepare, monitor and manage detailed project schedules. Bridge Engineer-Civil Engineer III - (181290) 
Job Type: Full-Time Exempt
Primary Location: US-CA-Rancho Cordova
Other Locations: US-CA-Walnut Creek, US-CA-Santa Ana, US-CA-Ontario, US-CA-Sacramento
Description
 WHO WE ARE
Supported by more than 3,000 employees in nearly 100 locations across the United States, we provide a full continuum of engineering and consulting services, including design, planning, architectural, environmental, construction and program management. Our clients include U.S. federal, state and municipal governments, foreign allied governments, and a wide range of commercial clients. Michael Baker is committed to delivering a standard of excellence that fosters a culture of innovation, collaboration and technological advancement to help solve our clients' complex challenges.

BRIDGE PRACTICE 
Michael Baker International has addressed bridge design, construction and preservation challenges with innovative and sustainable solutions.  Exemplifying its depth and versatility in the bridge space, Michael Baker International, ranked Number Five by Engineering News-Record in its annual ranking of Bridge Design Firms in the United States, has partnered with clients on a full spectrum of bridge types-from conventional grade separations to major, complex river crossings, including trusses, arches, box girders and cable-stayed bridges.

DESCRIPTION
As a part of our Bridge Design Team, the Civil Engineer III is responsible for structural design and analysis of civil engineering and infrastructure projects for transportation related structures including bridges, retaining walls, and flood control structures. You will leverage your engineering knowledge and skills to prepare bridge planning studies, construction documents, reports and calculations. You will have the opportunity to lead a team of engineers and designers.

•Prepares moderately complex studies, construction documents (PS&E), drawings, reports and supporting documentation.
•You may have the opportunity to work on Design-Build projects and interact with contractors on a daily basis.
•Develop and maintain software for finite element modeling/analysis and bridge analysis, design, and load rating. 
•Assist with the development of technical specifications for proposed designs.
•Prepares quantities and construction cost estimates.
•Reviews quantities and construction cost estimates prepared by others.
•Supervises the preparation of construction drawings for structural engineering projects.
•Performs QA/QC reviews of construction drawings.
•Occasionally visits work site, monitoring project progress.
•Communicates with clients regarding project issues, holds and attends meetings.
•Defines scope of work and man-hour requirements.
•Responsible for proposal production and implementing marketing initiatives.
•Responsible for ensuring that task and project schedules and budgets are met.
•Serves as the project task manager; responsible for all facets of the task or discipline of the project.
•Coordinates with CADD technicians to ensure timely and accurate document or drawing preparation.
•Responsible for maintaining technical knowledge through completion of various training initiatives: attending seminars, reviewing professional publications, attending in-house systems/management training.
•Consult with senior engineers and task managers to review analyses, calculations, and designs and to discuss revisions as necessary. 
•Review bridge engineers' calculations, analyses, designs, load ratings, and specification checks, and propose revisions as necessary. 
•Additional skills desired include experience with programming such as .NET framework and object-oriented software design

PROFESSIONAL REQUIREMENTS
•Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering. Prefer Master’s degree
•Requires Professional Engineer (P.E.) License. 
•10 years of progressive work experience.
•Requires experience in finite element (FEM) software programming as it relates to bridge/structural projects.
•Must possess knowledge of LRFD, ASD, and LFD methods, AASHTO design specifications, and finite element analysis theory. Must have experience in software testing and validation.
